campaign.story:
Click the Image above to watch the video in 4k! 

SCINTILLATING! NERVE WRACKING! GRITTY! BALLSY! CLAUSTROPHOBIC! ONE OF THE BEST MOVIES OF THE DECADE! A POWER PUNCH OF GUTS AND GLAMOUR! HOTTEST FEMALE ACTION HERO - EVER!
That was critics worldwide reviewing our 2015 internationally released film CRAWL or DIE! Guess what friends... WEEEEE'RRREEEE BBBAAAAHHHHCCCKKKKK!  (reference anyone) 
NICOLE ALONSO: We did it! Again... TANK is BACK! 
OKLAHOMA WARD: TANK is not back for just one storyline - not two storylines... nope - we've been filming night and day for a solid year! 
NICOLE ALONSO: WE GOT NEWS!!!!!!
OKLAHOMA WARD: Wait... Nicole, tell them who we are and why we're here.
NICOLE ALONSO: Right - that's me, (Actress and Singer... aka 'TANK' in the movie CRAWL or DIE.) - and he is...
OKLAHOMA WARD:  Indie filmmaker. Nicole - tell  them why we are here...
NICOLE ALONSO: Okay -  let me and Oak push our rescue dog  'BABY GIRL" and rescue cat 'WEDNESDAY" off our laps. There. Right - Oklahoma and I live in our film studio where filmed CRAWL or DIE.
OKLAHOMA WARD: That studio resides In a little town outside of Tulsa, Oklahoma. Our studio is actually a large pole barn. Yes - we live in a barn.  What do we do beside exist on this planet ... well, we make movies. It's not a hobby. We both take it seriously and are passionate about it. We make movies that are in 5.1 - scored - color corrected - QC passed per Industry standards... legit - finished projects down to the artwork and trailers. Proof - CRAWL or DIE - Hollywood bought and sold.
NICOLE ALONSO: CRAWL or DIE was given worldwide distribution. The movie can be found in movie theaters and stores across the US, the UK, Switzerland, Japan, Mexico, Russia, etc. The CRAWL or DIE experience was incredible!
OKLAHOMA WARD: it hit international in 2015 and just three weeks ago - it was dubbed - horribly dubbed ... hilariously dubbed -  in Russian.THREE weeks ago lol. Show them Nikki...
NICOLE ALONSO: You got to see this lol - here...
PLAY

OKLAHOMA WARD:  Are we bragging - nah. We live in a GARAGE lol. Ya' know what though - Nicole, I - and all involved in CRAWL or DIE are damn proud of our hard work and passion. Our fans made the whole multi-year journey just the absolute BEST!
NICOLE ALONSO ...CHEERS! *He's laughing at me lol*
OKLAHOMA WARD: Tell them why we are here...
NICOLE ALONSO Right! Well... below is the official statements... 


Hey, fans and friends, new and old.
Welcome to the #TANKarmy and to our Kickstarter campaign! For those of you that are new here, we are Indie director, Oklahoma Ward, and actress and singer, Nicole Alonso. You may remember us from our first feature-length movie, Crawl or Die.
In 2015, after a lot of blood, sweat and tears we released our very first film, CRAWL or DIE, under the banner of our own production company, Backyard Films. We were so excited that, upon release, our film was given worldwide distribution. CRAWL or DIE could be found in movie theaters and stores across the US, the UK, Switzerland, Japan, Mexico, Russia, etc. This was incredible news! Unfortunately, what this also meant was that the majority of profits went to our distributors, who raked in a lot of money, while we – in three-plus years total – made less than five figures.

Make no mistake - we are not griping. We are ECSTATIC with the amount of fans that we gained from the movie. But we also learned every inch of the business and this time we are approaching distribution from an experienced point of view.

After its initial release, we were approached by multiple larger film studios offering us budgets beyond our wildest dreams to sign with them. However, we knew that in doing so, we would have to compromise the vision of the character of TANK that we – and you – had for her/our films.  That was just something we weren't willing to do. We were told that without their money, we'd never be able to make anything better than what we had already done. And that was when we realized we had made the right choice because a company that doesn't believe in us, isn't one we want to be associated with.

And so, with heart, and grit, and you by our sides, we came to the realization that what we lacked in funds, we made up for in love and loyalty. You guys, our fans – our loyal #TANKarmy – have been worth more to us than any amount of money. We've read every message, and email, and letter you've sent us, and through all of that, one thing became abundantly clear to Oklahoma and myself. You wanted more TANK. You needed a sequel. You demanded a sequel. And so - sequel(s) you shall have!
For over a year now, we have been filming the follow-ups to CRAWL or DIE that you have all been dreaming of. It's bigger and better than ever. Larger sets, different locations, and an even bigger cast. We can't share many details right now, but we can say that TANK IS BACK! And she is back with a vengeance. And this time, she will come face-to-face with the Alien in a battle you'll have to see! We have a team of over 40 incredible and devoted people, including waiters, hair stylists, factory workers, blue collar workers, etc. – all working for free – who, along with Oklahoma and myself, and the rest of our cast, have been hard at work, right here in the Midwest, creating a project that we are all super proud of and cannot wait to show you.

And here's where you come in. Because our vision for this sequel is so much bigger than CRAWL or DIE, and because we didn't make much profit from our first film, we've run into a budgeting snag. We made the decision to film in 4K, which meant we needed five hard drives just to store the footage. The last hard drive we had to buy basically wiped out our budget for the theme song I plan to record, as well as the score, and some of the post-production costs. So we are turning to you, the fans – our #TANKarmy – to help us ensure we give you a film that not only we, but you as well, can be proud of.
We are so proud to have our brand new cast members that have joined us also! 
Dan Langley, Lorie Northrup Crabtree, Matt Crabtree, Larry Huitt, Tana Greenlee, Rim Adel Basma, Lara Barauna, Sean Stark, Jeremy Sellers, Allison Harper, Martin Kamm, Nathaniel Davis, Donny Griffin, Brittany Bruton, David Zeliff Jason Sunday, Avalon Howard, Willam Langley, Hannity Feamster, Haven Bruton, Donna Ledford, Carissa McGee, Tyler Bolton, Jean Langley, Landon Frank and Myretta Ballou!
We don't expect - nor would we accept a - gift of money. Instead - we felt grand offering merchandise for money! I and Oklahoma are proud to offer the perks below for your help! Check them out! 

THE REWARDS:
We have awesome custom rewards for this campaign! Check them out below or see the descriptions to the right for further details.
We vow to make this a fun experience for you and us! For backers only - we will be updating special challenges with special gifts in the backers only section. We will also be sharing exclusive content in the backers only section multiple times during the week. 

Also as a quick reminder - Kickstarter is an ALL or NOTHING platform. If we do not meet our goal by the end of the campaign - you will not be charged and we won't get any of the money.

Please remember - we have been involved with 2 campaigns that were successful. We have already filmed the movie - we are in Post Production so please don't feel that your donation is going towards a project or towards people that may never start their project. 

No matter what - even if you can't donate - sharing, telling your friends - all of it - is why we are here. We will be live constantly - most probably daily - and feel free to reach out, talk, ask questions and send me candy corn, lol. Oak hates candy corn which means more for me. Much love! 

Nicole & Oklahoma 
...TANK out.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Every project brings it's unique challenges and this one is no exception. We knew when we started this project it was going to be a HUGE mountain to climb. Filming a series is quadruple the amount of work to filming a one off film. Each episode is like a whole movie in and of itself. We learned quickly on set and adapted well to this heightened workload and have been loving the challenge. 

Principal photography is just about wrapped up and we have moved at record speed getting all the footage shot. It took us just over year to film and now we are excited to head into the post production phase and meet all of the challenges it has to bring head on!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Frank Miller's iconic story Batman: The Dark Knight Returns comes to life in a single-player strategy board game experience crafted by acclaimed game designers Morgan Dontanville (Asgard’s Chosen) and Daryl Andrews (Sagrada). Your skills will be tested across four scenarios, or Books, that each feature unique rules, allies, abilities, and epic boss battles! You'll have a limited amount of resources and turns to complete each of these four Books, and if Batman's Grit, Sanity, or Health ever drops to zero, it's game over…
Beyond staying alive in the short term, the world's greatest detective also has to plan for the long term: The "Doomsday Clock" persists across all four Books, as does the constantly evolving and always chaotic Gotham City. If the Doomsday Clock ever strikes midnight or Gotham becomes too overrun with Riots, it’s all over (hang up your cape and cowl... or try again!).
Each Book lasts four rounds and, in that time, you'll have to acquire enough Clues to track down the Boss's location, and then dispense justice by defeating them in order to progress to the next Book.
Gameplay each round is split into two halves. In the first half, you strategically pick your favorite Fight and Detective cards, which grant you unique abilities to prepare for future battles and for navigating Gotham. But think twice, because each of the cards you don't select has a unique Event that becomes part of the Event deck, which triggers each turn to keep you on your toes! In the second half of each round, Batman and his allies (such as Robin) will take to the streets of Gotham. Combine Ally Actions with Batman for some awesome combos!
After each round, you'll be able to DRAW directly on the board to create a new pathway between locations in Gotham. Make your way towards locations with possible leads; you may hit dead ends, DESTROY locations, or find Clues. Find enough Clues, and you'll learn the location of the Boss. Take down the Boss in order to complete the Book!
With a variable setup and a nearly endless combination of Fight, Detective, and Event cards, each playthrough of Batman: The Dark Knight Returns - The Game will throw a unique combination of resources and challenges at you!
           
 
For the uninitiated, The Dark Knight Returns is likely the most beloved Batman story ever told. Writer/artist Frank Miller’s four-issue series from 1986 was a watershed moment in comics, as it brought a dark and cinematic feel to the medium. Every Batman story since then owes something to it.
Let’s set the scene: In Batman: The Dark Knight Returns, Gotham City is controlled by a brutal street gang called the Mutants and, since it’s the 1980s, the US and USSR appear to be on a collision course for mutual nuclear destruction. Also, being a superhero is illegal and Superman is now an agent for the government. It’s pretty dystopian, to say the least.
As for Bruce Wayne, he is 55 years old, way past his prime. And he’s been retired for years, ever since the Joker murdered Jason Todd, the last Robin. Spurred by the Mutants’ crimes and a reminder about the murder of his parents, he returns to his crime-fighting ways, but with a new edge. This time, he’s not holding anything back, using every bit of his smarts and battered body to take on the Mutant Leader, old archenemies the Joker and Two-Face, and even Superman, his one-time good friend. With Carrie Kelley, the new Robin, at his side, the Dark Knight takes another stand for justice and the soul of the city (and world) that he has defended for so long.

Our goal is to send you an amazing-looking game, but even more importantly, it has to play amazingly well. We are working hard to optimize every aspect of this game as we finalize it.

Risks and challenges
This is not our first rodeo! Cryptozoic has run several Kickstarters in the past, and we have learned a lot. We know fans invest not only their funds but their time in supporting Kickstarter campaigns. We take your commitment very seriously, and in return we are determined to provide you the very best game we can as quickly as possible. However, even in normal times, delays can happen due to unexpected issues, such as shipping container delays, factory issues, bad weather, and more. These are clearly NOT normal times due to the COVID-19 pandemic, making any projected timelines uncertain. You have our word that we will do our best to mitigate delays and communicate about them to all the backers.

updates.update_userinfo: Late Nights for The Dark Knight
updates.update_content:
DKR Fans,
We have been silent as of late and there’s a reason: Like The Dark Knight himself, our team has been completely focused on the mission at hand. Are we trying to save Gotham City from violence and corruption too? Well, no, but our goal is nearly as noble: We’re trying to make Batman: The Dark Knight Returns — The Game the best experience it can be.
Our team has been burning the midnight oil to make sure to hit our production deadlines. We’ve been working with our amazing designers— Morgan Dontanville and Daryl Andrews—and our talented editor to finalize all the gameplay details. Our in-house project managers and graphic designers have been putting their hearts into making sure everything looks and plays as well (if not better) than you expect.

Soon, you’ll receive an email from us with a special link to your BackerKit survey. It’s important to respond to your survey as quickly as you can since we need this information to fulfill your rewards. In order to lock in the orders and get started on production, we'll need to set a deadline for everyone to provide their addresses and do any upgrades or add-ons to their order by. THIS DEADLINE IS MAY 31, 2021.
You don’t need to create a BackerKit account to fill out your survey. When you receive the email with the survey, click the survey link to respond. Answer the questions about your reward preferences, provide shipping information, and purchase add-on items if you like. You don’t have access to this survey link yet, but it will be available soon via email!

Hey everyone! 
For all of you late-comers who have been reaching out to us about missing out on the campaign, we decided to activate a Late Backer Page through our partners at Backerkit with all reward tiers that were available during the campaign. To go there, simply click on the 'LATE BACKERS GO HERE!' Blue Button at the top of the campaign page (image below for reference).

Thank you for making our project a reality! A few things need to happen before we can kick off production and fulfillment:
First, Kickstarter needs to transfer over the funds so we have the money to make the rewards (this can take up to two weeks).
Second, we have to find out where we need to ship the rewards and collect more info. We’ll send out a BackerKit survey for this, and that should go out in about two weeks.

campaign.story:
Zombies can simply be movie monsters, or they can be symbols.  They can be a metaphor for plague.  They can also represent constant problems that don't seem to go away.
The director decided to make his zombies represent conformity, but you are still free to interpret the story your own way.

Rather than a trailer, we showed you some behind-the-scenes footage
You may possibly support this movie, so we'd like you to see the way that we are filming it.  You get to know the kind of people who are involved in the project.
The footage that you saw was paid using the surplus money from a previous kickstarter.  
There is more to film, which is why this crowdfunder exists.  Whether we raise $600 or $60,000, the movie will be finished according to the resources that we will have.  (Actually, if we raise $60,000, we will call back the cast to re-film their parts so we can match the improvements of the new footage).

If you resonate with the footage that you have seen, and if you feel drawn toward our fun-loving personalities, then you are welcome to take a chance on this film.  It may have zombies, but it's not a genre-movie.  This is an experimental work.  It is being made as a creative exercise, not for commercial reasons.  (Yes, it will have guaranteed distribution, so it commercial in that sense, but it's not made for broad appeal.  We're taking a chance on the free-thinking writing).

Have a look at the plentiful items that offered for your enjoyment.  Take another look at the behind-the-scenes moments and decide if you are attracted to something like this.

I might have finished filming "DICKLESS ZOMBIES" - I say might because I do have an alternate plotline that could be filmed.  Don't worry - I am not asking for money.  The reason why I have not filmed this alternate footage is because the movie might be too long (although you might be a fan of the 3.5 hour version of "Dickshark"). If I DO film that footage, it will be within 3 weeks.

campaign.story:
*** patent pending***
Because of the fantastic support received from the community, all backers will receive a free mug adapter with each CouchConsole™



The gyroscope system ensures your cup will stay in a vertical position no matter how uneven or soft the surface you put the Couch Console on is.
The Cup Holder will fit most standard glasses, and you can also lock the system.






To get the most out of it, we made the modules independent from one another so you can customize the layout just the way you like it.
Are you having two types of beverages? Just add two cup modules. 
Need to store more items? Just put the cup in the snack module and use the spacer to divide it accordingly. 








 The Couch Console has a USB C plug on top. The USB C hub goes directly to the storage space where you can connect any external battery you have. 
We didn't include a battery because most of us already have external batteries we can use, and it would unnecessarily increase the cost of the product.
Cables, batteries, evens snacks don't have to stay scattered anymore - we've incorporated a generous storage area in the couch console where you can store all the essentials you need close by.


 We’re doing our part in creating a product with minimal impact on the environment. The base of the CC is made out of recycled foam. This does not affect the quality but makes it environmentally friendly. Having the base made out of foam allows us to keep the weight down, making it easy to move around the house.   
Also, because the CC is a long-life product, it won't become obsolete and thrown away like many everyday products. 


*as we have 24h left and close to unlock the $2.5mil goal, we've decided to make it available already

Each Couch Console comes with our four primary modules: one self-balancing cupholder, one snack cup, one spacer, and one organizer tray.
color combos - if you have two - you can mix the parts
The super-dense foam is the perfect material for the CC's base as it has a high resistance to compression while keeping the weight of the product down.

We love the cupholders in our cars, so why not enjoy the "luxury" of having a cupholder on our couch?

Peters started the company this year and the team has been constantly growing. Now we are 5, each with it's own role - design, prototyping, production, logistics and support and will continue to grow. Since day one, we've set our mission - create a unique product that we would be proud of. And not just any product but the Couch Console. 

Getting to the point we are now wasn't easy - it took a full year of work, hundreds of designs, and numerous prototypes. We collaborated with designers and manufacturers worldwide to find the balance between a practical design that would look awesome and be long-lasting.  

Shapes and sizes we've tested


This campaign is promoted by Backercamp. Since 2012, Backercamp has helped 5,000+ creators make their projects a reality, raising over $300MM through crowdfunding.

campaign.story:
FEREF: UNSEEN
An intimate and unique look into the poster archive of one of the world’s leading movie marketing companies, featuring never seen before concept art for some of the world's biggest  films. 

Since 1968, Feref has helped to advertise some of the biggest and best-loved movies in the history of cinema and this book is a visual record of their most memorable work. It gives an in-depth insight into their archive, featuring pieces from over 3,500 films, acting as a love letter to the hard work and dedication of the artists that created stunning movie posters across 6 decades.
Each page will show treasures from across the collection in stunning detail, from source material and first concept sketches to work in progress illustrations and even alternative ideas that have never before seen the light of day. It will illustrate how an idea was transformed into an iconic image that needed to stop traffic and sell tickets.
The paintings, illustrations and alternative layouts will be as close as you can get to standing over their shoulder and watching as they paint the posters the world fell in love with. 
This isn’t just another collection of movie posters; this is a one-of-a-kind insight into the world of film advertising, featuring words and works of some of the greatest movie poster artists of all time. This beautiful book is for poster fans, for film fans and for anyone who appreciates art in all its forms. 
FEREF: UNSEEN - over 200 pieces of movie art / 200 pages / 32x25cm

updates.update_content:
Hello friends of Feref, 

Hope you're all having a good day. Just wanted to share that I've received the final proofs from the printers, so have had a very pleasant hour going through them for approval, which means it's about to actually hit the presses. Here are some pics:

Hello, 

Firstly, please accept my huge apologies at the delay in getting the book finished. We have been extremely busy of late and we haven't had the capacity or the time to commit. 

However, the good news is that the book is now finished! All of the content is locked and artworked, so we now have print-ready files that will shortly be given to the printer.

Dear Friends of Feref, 
Hope you are all well - just wanted to keep you in the loop. The majority of the book is ready to print; however we're just waiting for a final update on any new discoveries that could go in. Otherwise, apart from getting the upfront pages designed (intros and content list) and finalising details with the printer, then we're good to go.

Hello friends of Feref,

Just wanted to let you know that all the content has been chosen for the book so we’re now in the process of designing the final layout. Very exciting.

Also, we have another special announcement to make: due to the international interest we’ve had around the archive since the start of this Kickstarter campaign, Feref have teamed up with Propstore to auction some key pieces of artwork (in photographic transparency form) on 22nd April.  There’s a lot more info on this sneak peek page, where you can also sign up to see the full catalogue 72 hours before the auction is announced: 

We’ll keep you posted with more book news soon!

Best,

Feref

Dear friends of Feref,

Apologies for the belated message but just wanted to say that we're absolutely delighted with the response to the book and hitting our funding goal. Thank you all so much for your support. 
You'll be pleased to know that we've started pulling all the content together and have unearthed even more gems! We'll keep you updated as the design process continues.

As of yesterday we've hit our £10k target and beyond! Many thanks to all of you who have pledged and shared. To say we are excited to start production on the book and share some of the incredible archive with you would be an understatement. 

Thanks again,

Drayton Hayes was a heavyweight boxer who was a number one contender for the belt when his career was abruptly sabotaged. He hit skid row, but was starting to make a comeback when he was kidnapped by a bizarre troupe of scoundrels calling themselves the Vaude-Villains. The mysterious mobsters convinced Drayton to join them, and he underwent a transformation which turned him into a super-powered murderous clown named Punchline!  The character was an instant fan-favorite after his debut in issue #1 of Tap Dance Killer (April of 2018.) 
Punchline is about to meet the main superhero from our universe, Apama, for the ultimate throwdown. Then we're introducing a new nemesis from beyond the grave that will dual Punchline to the death for his very soul. 
Punchline and the Vaude-Villains is a series that turns on a dime from horror to comedy, and from the super-heroic to the dark and supernatural. No knowledge of previous stories is required to enjoy this series. (Although... there are rewards that bundle all of our previous stories.)

Survey will give you option to have them signed or not.
This collector's edition is only offered through Kickstarter. 
48 pages, full color, glossy paper.
Main cover by series artist Donny Hadiwidjaja

Planned as a five issue series

Why Kickstarter?
Even though our work is distributed nationally through Diamond Comics, without comic convention income, the numbers just don't make financial sense.  We made the tough decision to wait until the cons started happening again for new releases. And we waited and waited... and it's time to try something new. 

Kickstarter has been great for us in the past, so we're trying a new model to get stories out to our beloved readers while offering a KILLER deal to people who are new to the Hero Tomorrow Comics shared universe.

This issue is fully illustrated, and over half-colored. The lettering is around 80% complete. I expect to be ready to go to press by the time the campaign ends, and rewards will ship within a month of the campaign's completion.

campaign.story:
September 6th - 100% Funded, Introducing first stretch goal
You can hardly believe it - we're over 100% funded! Thank you to everyone who's backed us so far! Any extra money is going towards helping us to secure additional high-profile interviews and license some "wishlist" music we otherwise couldn't afford. So we're introducing our first stretch goal to encourage anyone who's tempted to back us, or even increase their pledge.
Stretch Goal #1: £17,500 - Receive a seasonal postcard
If we raise £17,500 before the campaign ends, we will produce a series of seasonal postcards featuring some familiar faces from the film, and will be delivering one to each backer on every tier (£10 or higher).
 August 30th - Tiers Update! 
We've just passed the £10,000 mark and are over two-thirds funded. Thank you to everyone who has backed us! To show our appreciation, we're updating the rewards tiers, as well as adding a new tier. 
All tiers (£10 or higher) will receive an exclusive desktop background. If you pledged Farmhand (£25) or higher, you're getting a high-resolution download of our poster. If you pledged Cattle Farmer (£200) or higher, you'll now received a print of our poster signed by the director, Oscar Harding.
We've also introduced a new tier - Colour Schemer (£125 or higher) - which offers both T-Shirts (S-XXL) and upgrades your "Thank You" credit in the film to "Special Thanks".
If you've pledged Poultry Farmer (£75) or higher and have already made use of our backer referral scheme (refer 3 new backers and get upgraded to the tier above yours), don't worry - you'll still be upgraded to Cattle Farmer and skip the new tier.
We’ve Got Something To Show You…
My Grandfather, who lived in the rural English county of Somerset, passed away a decade ago. Amongst his possessions was a videotape from one of his neighbours, a farmer called Charles Carson. I could never have anticipated the kind of journey that Charles and his tape would take me on. 
Charles’ feature-length home movie, “Life On The Farm”, can best be described as “Monty Python meets The Texas Chainsaw Massacre”.
Self-shooting, editing and scoring everything manually, Charles’ home movies are hilarious, imaginative and completely unique. If you’re looking for skeletons riding lawnmowers; cow births from multiple angles; a rendition of Scotland The Brave performed on pieces of tractor machinery; or a close-up look at a placenta, you’ll love “Life On The Farm”.
A screenshot from one of Charles' home movies
The video goes to places that some might consider to be pretty dark. There’s a real argument to be made that Charles was an early pioneer of the Selfie and the Death Positivity Movement. He’s a remarkable, undiscovered outsider artist and it’s time his story was told.
Desperate to learn more about the man and his movies, I’ve embarked on a years-long journey that’s been full of twists and turns. I’ve discovered that Charles has appeared on TV multiple times with his inventions and his award-winning photography, from Tomorrow’s World to You’ve Been Framed!, and it turns out that we’re not the only people who fell in love with his work…
A Life On The Farm is an exploration and celebration of Charles Carson and his movies, which present a moving and laugh-out-loud document of a time and place in danger of being lost to history.
The Team
Oscar Harding, director of the documentary
There’s me - Oscar Harding. As well as directing the documentary, I feature prominently in it, guiding you through the story. I’ve worked in various capacities - including research, distribution and marketing - for documentaries and independent films in the UK, Ireland and the USA that have been nominated for BAFTAs, a BIFA and an Academy Award.
Edward Lomas, Dominik Platen and Hannah Christensen
Also producing are Edward Lomas and Dominik Platen, my partners at Sonderbar Pictures. Edward is an experienced director and DP and has shot a variety of shorts, documentaries, music videos and commercials. His latest short ‘Benefits’ was produced as part of Channel 4’s Random Acts and screened at Curzon Cinemas nationwide. Dominik has experience as a director, writer and producer on various short films and documentaries and most recently was a finalist in the prestigious 2019 The Pitch Film Fund. He has also earned a number of credits as VFX artist and 2D supervisor on blockbusters including The Lion King, Jurassic World: Fallen Kingdom and the upcoming Morbius.
In addition to some brilliant crew across the UK and USA - including our incredibly talented editor Hannah Christensen - our documentary has attracted the interest and support of Joe Pickett and Nick Prueher of The Found Footage Festival, who have not only invested in the project but have also come onboard as Executive Producers. 
Joe Pickett and Nick Prueher (Found Footage Festival), Executive Producers
Between us, we have enough experience across documentary filmmaking and various international film industries that Charles’ story is in safe hands. We’ve worked hard to ensure the documentary is every bit as engaging and entertaining as the home movies it’s investigating.
What We’ve Done So Far
We’ve filmed almost all of our interviews, and our rough cut of the film is shaping up very nicely. We have discovered more about the story of Charles and his home movies by interviewing family members and people in his village who knew him best, as well as those who have become huge fans of his work. We feature everyone from a vicar and a psychologist, to a journalist for The Guardian and farmers in their 80s. In addition to Joe and Nick, we have also interviewed the wonderful guys at Everything Is Terrible!, who also count themselves as fans of Charles’ work.    
Everything Is Terrible! have conducted an interview for the documentary
We have a hell of a story to tell, but we need to finish principal photography, complete post-production to the highest possible standard, and launch a marketing and festival campaign that ensures we can reach as many people as possible.
What We Need
A breakdown of how money will be spent if we reach our goal
There are still a few loose threads to Charles’ story that we need to wrap up, including his time lecturing at an agricultural college, and one or two high-profile interviewees we’re not able to announce just yet across multiple countries.
But most of the money will be going towards finishing post-production, including:
Editing
Sound Design
Sound Mixing
Color Grading
Music Licensing
Sourcing and Clearing Archive Footage
Legal Fees - Copyright, etc.
Once the film is complete, we have a festival strategy ready, and any support from backers will help cover the costs of submissions and travel to the festivals, so we can answer whatever burning questions audiences have about Charles’ story and the making of the film... whenever we're able to get back to attending festivals in-person!
Not to forget, of course, Kickstarter’s fees for hosting this campaign and the production & shipping of our rather wonderful rewards... 
What We’re Offering
A Life On The Farm has been a personal passion project years in the making. Every single cent (or penny, depending on where you’re backing us from) is seriously appreciated. But gratitude is not enough - we’ve got some great perks in return for whatever you can give to support this film, including your name in the credits. Charles made his movies for as many people as possible to enjoy, and we think it’s rather fitting to have you all associated with his work.
We're giving away T-shirts - from an environmentally and socially responsible vendor who produces sweatshop-free goods from recycled waste materials, with methods that use up the 7 times less water than most manufacturers- as well as digital and physical copies of the film, and for those who happen to still have a VCR stashed away somewhere, copies on VHS. 
Our beautiful poster artwork by Somerset artist Ellie Powell
For those who are able to contribute more, we’re able to offer some exclusive rewards. As well as various producer credits on the film also up for grabs, we’ll also be offering a private online screening featuring live commentary with Joe and Nick of The Found Footage Festival, and a Q&A with the filmmakers.
If we are successfully funded, the production of the film may be coming to an end, but the journey of A Life On The Farm will only just be beginning - we’re going to keep everyone updated as we complete post-production, share any more incredible revelations, send photos and videos of the final steps, and let you all know how production of the rewards is coming along. When we get accepted into festivals, you’ll be the first to know.

However, in these unpredictable times, we have to allow for potential delays in production and shipping of our various rewards. Other delays to allow for are festival screenings - depending on where we are screening, we may have to wait a little bit longer to share the film with our backers.

campaign.story:
Hello there internet, my name is James Roll and it has taken 2 crazy years to get to this point but we are finally here.
I am creating a website/app for IOS and android called: 
Pocketvid is a video platform that seeks to fix all of the problems that content creators have with other video platforms by listening to its community, making sure there are very few false copyright claims, while also having no demonetization on their videos so they can actually get monetization from users just watching their videos. We also reward users for watching the content creators that they love by giving them points that they can redeem for gift cards, content creator merch, or to donate to their favorite creators.
Rewarding Users on the Platform
The biggest draw for users is the fact that users get rewarded for watching the content creators that they love. Here is how it works: Users watch the content, they get points for watching the content based on the number of ads that play, and the user can redeem those points for content creator merch, for gift cards, or they can just donate them to their favorite content creators. 
Users getting points for watch creator's content does 3 things.
1.  Users will want to watch content more because they are getting rewarded for watching the content that they love when they normally wouldn't anywhere else.
2. Users have a reason to watch here instead of on other platforms because if they love a creator's content then why not get rewarded to watch it?
3. It helps content creators get their user base to the platform that would normally not switch over to watch because it incentivizes them to do so. 
Advertiser Friendly Content
The most popular content platform has several major issues that has content creators fearing yellow buttons raining from the skies and the first one is Advertiser Friendly Content. On Pocketvid we don't demonetize content. Either it is allowed on the platform or it isn't. So in other words all content can be monetized!! Basically, the rule of thumb is: Is it allowed on the most popular content platform? Then it can be monetized on Pocketvid.  Creators will have the option to demonetize their own content or donate the proceeds of a video to charity if they so choose based on the content of that video.
Copyright and False Claims
Copyright on video platforms can be a nightmare because you can work hard on a video for hours just to get the video taken down or the video monetized for a different company. Well worry not my content creator friends!!! We have got you covered. We care about content creators on the platform and we want to work with you and the company so that you always get paid for the video that you post. You adding a single 3 second piece of music, you showing a clip of a TV show to criticize it or review it, or someone claiming that something is their content when their content is not even present; these practices need to end and we want the platform to do something about it. These are ways we want to try to fix the problem with copyright:
We will review all claims as they come in to verify if it is a false claim or not. 
If it is a false claim we will let you know that a claim was submitted but disregarded as it was not valid.
If it is a valid claim then we will let you know what is wrong within the video and let you know how to revise the video to make it fair use. If the video still is determined to be violating fair use and you submit an updated version of the video we will then review the revised video to verify what change you made or you can ask for a second review of the video if you feel that the video does not violate fair use. 
If no change was made to the video then you can take down the video, request partial monetization, or you can file a counter notification if you think we are still incorrect and the should be monetized fully. In that case the filer of the case will have to take legal action to proceed.
If a change was made to the video but it was not what was needed then we will ask for another revision until it is fixed, you decide to request partial monetization, or you decide to remove the video
Partial monetization of a video will be available in certain circumstances that we can work with the filer of the claim to get money for all parties
When a video is claimed monetization does not stop at any point. All of the money becomes held and will be released after the claim in resolved.
If you have any questions on copyright send us a message and we will get back to you  and potentially add the info to this list.
 Platform Features
Just about any feature that you have seen on other platforms will be on this platform. The features on the platform that make us distinct from other platforms are as follows: 
Content Creator Merch as rewards
Collapse-able merch bar below creator's videos that will direct users to the creator's merch store or allow the user to use their rewards for the purchase.
The ability to fully customize the look, feel, style, and structure of your channels or account.
Rewards for watching videos with ads
Playlists with additional functionality like inverting the order of the list of the videos and subscribing to playlists
You will be able to subscribe to playlists, channels, and the creators who made those channels. Some channels can have more than one creator linked to it because they could be a team.
Each channel will have some sort of community tab that can be renamed to whatever they want their community to be called. 
Got an idea for any other features that don't exist on other platform? Let us know at james@pocketvid.tv or contact us here on kickstarter.
Live Streaming
With a platform like this it only makes sense to have live streaming added into the platform. We want to use what we have to change the game in live streaming for creators to give them the tools that they could use to succeed. Here is what we want to add:
We will integrate stream labs into the platform so that when a user donates to you we will not take a cut of that revenue. 
There will be a commercial break feature that will play an ad in the middle of your stream when you select it. Users will get rewarded for watching the ads and can use them to give back to the creators!
The video generated from a live stream can create problems when it comes to copyright laws and fair use. We will set up a system (hopefully just by integrating stream labs) that will record the live stream with all of the different pieces of the video being integrated. This means when you go live and the stream is recorded we will record the notifications, you, the game you are playing, and anything else you want to have as an input separately so you can stream without fear and only parts of a section of the recorded video will be removed if necessary. 
Paid subscriptions will exist on channels that will allow users to chose the number of tiers they want to have, the cost of these tiers, and the number of emotes that are available to the users for those tiers or special content for those users. We will allow creators to have up to 75 emotes for their users and potentially even more as time goes on.
Users will be able to use their points to subscribe to a channel with the paid subscriptions allowing them to use their points to support their favorite creators in even more ways.
Backer Rewards
For $1 or more you will get your name on the Pocketvid wall of fame which will have all of the names of the backers on it starting from the most donated to the least donated.
You can get an Exclusive Pocketvid T-shirts for $20 or more in these styles:
You can get these Exclusive Pocketvid Hoodies for $35 or more in these styles:
You can get 1 Exclusive Pocketvid T-Shirt 1 Exclusive Pocketvid Hoodie for $55 or more.
For $500 or more you will become a part of the pocketvid beta to help improve the platform before the release and get 1 shirt and 1 hoodie.
Lastly, for $1000 or more you will get a permanent coveted spot in the beta testers group that will test all upcoming features on the platform, be part of the beta, get the shirt, and the hoodie. 
Where will the funds go?
We have several goals with this money. With the $40,000 we will be able to:
Finish the creation of the platform and all current features by hiring a larger team.
Pay for the legal fees we still need to pay for in regards to the DMCA and hire our attorney for the platform. 
Start our beta and start our outreach to content creators that we would love to have on the platform.
Fill our rewards store with the gift cards needed to supply the rewards to our users
Release the app/website in the United States to all users and to approved creators worldwide
Purchase server space enough to run the application and website.
Sadly all things that have to do with live streaming and launching worldwide will have to be stretch goals. This is because we wanted to at least get the minimum amount of costs out of the way that would make the platform releasable as soon as possible. 
Stretch Goals
$50,000 - We will start working on an international release. This will take much time as lots will have to go into making this platform be able to compete worldwide.
$85,000 - We will make the effort to add in live streaming. Live streaming has the same aspect with ads that you will get points for them. The creator will be able to use a commercial break button to run an ad to all viewers and they will be able to donate points to the creators they are watching. We will also try to integrate stream labs into the platform for donations.
$150,000 - We will work on hiring tons of staff so that we have people always on hand to fix your issues like reviewing videos and answering questions.
$300,000 - We will create our own AI system that will work hand in hand with reviewers to get rid of content on the platform that violates the Terms of Service and that is not considered Fair Use. We will also use this to review content on the platform that has copyrighted material to determine if the content is fair use or not and designate the content as fair use.
$700,000 - We will invest more into the international release in some high traffic markets. These markets are TBD but will most likely be countries such as the Philippines, India, South Korea, and some countries in the EU.
$1,000,000 - We will have some money for servers that we can use to manage traffic ourselves. We will need to acquire a housing unit and the internet to do it.
$2,000,000 - We will have all that we need made up for the world wide release to prepare the app and website with all of their different versions for the rest of the world. We will do a very slow release after we have gotten enough revenue to support the addition of the other countries. A slow release means we will open in selective countries as we have the means to do so.
$5,000,000 - We will be world wide all of the features we need for the app and site will be added. 
$8,000,000 - We will make a few server farms in the United States to become competitive with the other Video Platforms in the world. 
$20,000,000 - We will be able to create all of the server farms needed to build the entire company including hiring staff based on what our needs are. This will make us have real competition with the other large video platforms.
Remember that the stretch goals above are influenced by the fact that people will be using the platform and we will have revenue coming in. Depending on the number of users on the platform we will also be getting more ad companies on the platform and having our own advertisers that directly advertise with us that will pull in more revenue to fulfill all of these goals. 
Technical Stuff
How do ads work with paying the users?
We use rewarded video to cover the cost of rewarding the users. The breakdown of the pay from all of the ads will be 50-25-25, 50% of all ad revenue goes to the user rewards and the other 25% and 25% goes to the company and the content creator respectively. This can still change but this is the basic idea of how it would work. If it does change it will only be for the benefit for the users and creators to make them all make more.
How are you building the platform?
We are building the platform in flutter. It is new and does come with its challenges but it is easier to build in because once you have built an android app then it is easy to convert to being an IOS app.
Have any other technical questions? Send us a message and we will answer it here.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
There are many problems we will have when we start up that prevent us from just allowing just anyone and everyone to be able to just upload their content and international users from joining the platform. These include: 

1. The amount of server space and size of server infrastructure that allows us to accommodate all 
 people all over uploading content.

2. The laws of every nation of the world are different and for a content platform that makes things challenging because we want to make sure that we are abiding by the laws of every nation and have a tailored experience for each of those users.

3. The rewards will be different for each nation because the gift cards will need to be different for every nation and have to be tailored for those users.

These issues have caused us to decide that we will have to have a slow release if we only reach our basic funding goal. With our stretch goals we will be able to move closer and closer to allowing all people to upload and allowing all users to join the platform.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Environmentally friendly factories
Energy efficiency is important with any tech company. The plan is to host our own servers and have our own offices to house those servers. If we make these as energy efficient as possible we will be able to minimize our carbon footprint as well as save money for the company.

campaign.story:
Hello!  Kevin Thomas here, the founder of GravGrip™.  GravGrip™ is a hydraulic camera stabilizer for your cell phone and action camera.  GravGrip™ is waterproof, battery free, affordable, and ultra compact!  
GravGrip's first prototype was hand made over 5 years ago!  I have dedicated the last 3 years to developing and prototyping GravGrip's design in my spare time.  What started as a side project in college is now a product I'm ready to share with the world.  
To make this happen we need your help!  Back GravGrip™ today so we can start production!  Our manufacturing partners are ready, we will signal the green light as soon as our funding goal is accomplished.  GravGrip's design is production ready, so no need for long prototyping delays!  
We are offering GravGrip™ at a price you can't beat!  Get excited to explore your world with hydraulic camera stabilization!

GravGrip™ includes an Action Camera and Cell Phone adapter.
Mount your Cell Phone or Action Camera to GravGrip™ with the included adapters. Lock your camera into position by rotating the blue knob.
2 POSITIONS: Mount your camera in the "ROLL" position to keep a stable horizon or in the "TILT" position to easily capture those epic ultra low and high angle shots. Lock into position by rotating the blue knob.
Rotate weight set upwards to decrease gimbal speed or downwards to increase gimbal speed. Fine tune GravGrip™ to your liking. Twist the weights together to lock into position!
GravGrip's balance correction system is adjusted using hand force. Some camera's have an offset center of Gravity (hint hint: GoPro), easily level the horizon with a quick change in position. This system will NOT budge while in use!
Our custom extension pole is no joke! This pole has an unmatched premium feel to it. You will not be disappointed in our combo deal.
Enjoy a small sample of the work dedicated to GravGrip™ over the past few years. I can truthfully say blood, sweat, and tears were put into GravGrip's development.
Why would I purchase GravGrip™ if my camera has amazing internal image stabilization?
We get asked this a lot! And the answer is easy.  GravGrip™ is a great tool for videographers to not only increased stabilization in their videos, but to capture those hard to reach angles that would otherwise be impossible.  I have a GoPro Hero 8 Black and GravGrip™ in the tilt position is a game changer!  Transition with ease from ultra low to up high angles.  It's easy, and everyone will wonder how you did it!
GravGrip™ + Image Stabilization = Next Level Footage
Why doesn't GravGrip™ automatically come with a pole?
GravGrip™ can be mounted to any GoPro compatible mount and we know a lot of our customers will already have these items.  This ensures we can provide you the lowest price possible!  Don't have a pole?  You're in luck, we have a combo deal that includes a GravGrip™ custom designed extension pole or a 5" hand grip.  We strive to provide premium products, and our extension pole is just that.
Is GravGrip™ waterproof?
YES!  GravGrip's design is composed of zero electronics, all components are either stainless steel, aluminum or a durable plastic (glass filled nylon).  Please note:  GravGrip™ is not functional under water, but feel free to take GravGrip™ out in the rain for some epic shots without a worry!  If you get GravGrip™ wet with salt water we do recommend a cleaning with fresh water.  
Will GravGrip™ work with plus sized phones?
YES!  GravGrip™ has been successfully tested with many plus sized phones (iPhone 8 Plus, iPhone 11 Max, Galaxy S20, etc.).
Can GravGrip support added weight?  (ex: Phone Case, Phone Lens)
YES!  No need to take your case off while using GravGrip™ (unlike many electronic gimbals).  We have tested several cheap iPhone 11 lens with success (for weight testing purposes).  We do expect cell phones equipped with higher end lens to work without problems, just know there is no guaranteed.
Can GravGrip™ work on a chest or helmet mount?
GravGrip™ can mount to any GoPro® compatible mount, but we do not recommend mounting to your chest or helmet mount.  In some situations GravGrip™ will work on these mounts, but GravGrip™ is best paired with a pole.  The stabilization between your arm movement and GravGrip™ can produce amazing results. 
Can I use GravGrip™ in cold temperatures?
Yes, we have tested GravGrip™ at roughly -5 C for extended periods of time with no issue.  At colder temperatures, changes in GravGrip's hydraulic stabilization system may occur.  GravGrip's hydraulic fluid will stiffen and rotation speed will decrease.  You can counter this with adjusting the off set weight, but more testing needs to happen before confirmation. The good thing is you can disengage GravGrip's hydraulic system by removing the lid. In the roll position you can get a great balance without the use of hydraulics.  In this case, temperature will not play a roll in performance!  Hydraulics is a must in the "Tilt" position!
NOTE:  If GravGrip™ is kept indoors before use, it will take time for temperature to affect its operation.  Users will likely notice no change in performance.  If stored outside in low temperatures GravGrip™ will see noticeable changes to performance. 
Will GravGrip's weights loosen and fall off?
GravGrip's 2 counterweights are very secure when tightened against each other. Throughout all GravGrip™ testing we have completed, not once have they loosened! They take a good bit of force to break apart, but are still easily adjusted by hand.
Why wouldn't I buy GravGrip™?
We really don't know?!  Affordable, Waterproof, Ultra Compact, No Batteries?
Get Your Project Funded Today!


Return policy.  Kickstarter is a platform that allows creators to showcase their product ideas at a discounted price.  This price is a pre-order for our product.  The funds raised throughout our campaign will be used to manufacture GravGrip™.  In accordance with Kickstarter Terms of Use we will not offer refunds or returns for items that are not defected.  If you receive a defected unit please email kevin@gravgrip.com.
Global Shipping.  We are excited to be offering international shipping.  Please note we are not responsible for additional duty and taxes that may apply to your local importation laws.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
GravGrip™ is working with local US manufacturers to ensure a quality product and decrease the likelihood of distribution problems. During these hard times there are many unknowns for the future, we are constantly in contact with our manufacturers to ensure everything is still on schedule. All news will be relayed to our backers!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
campaign.env:
Environmental commitments
Visit our Environmental Resources Center to learn how Kickstarter encourages sustainable practices.
Long-lasting design
GravGrip's design is built to last. GravGrip™ is composed of few moving parts; fewer parts = fewer problems. GravGrip™ is constructed of glass filled nylon, aluminum, and stainless steel components. GravGrip™ is ready to service your current and future cameras.
Reusability and recyclability
E-Waste (Electronic Waste) is a huge environmental concern, and GravGrip's mechanical design eliminates this possibility. One GravGrip™ will provide stabilization for your current and future camera's.
Something else
GravGrip's retail packaging will be 100% recyclable. GravGrip's founder has a B.S. degree in Environmental Health; as a company we strive to reduce our environmental impact as much as possible!

campaign.story:
PLAY

Watch this quick unboxing video to see what comes with every Lumos Ultra and how it works. 
Lumos Ultra comes included with a wireless handlebar remote to make signalling as easy as pressing a button
Got an Apple watch? You can control the turn signals on Lumos Ultra by simply raising your arm.
Keep the sun and rain out of your eyes while you ride with an optional attachable visor.
Lumos Ultra will also come with an option to add MIPS. This is an extra safety feature that is built into the helmet to add protection against rotational motion transferred to the brain. Rotational motion affects the brain and increase the risk for minor and severe brain injuries.
PLAY


Chips On Board (COB) is a method of LED packaging which has a number of advantages over more conventional technologies. It allows for a more compact footprint whilst delivering a higher intensity of light meaning you’ll be seen from further away. It is also what gives the lights a more uniform look. We like to think of it as Currently Our Best LED technology.
It’s our most vented helmet yet. We’ve been listening to customer feedback and have paid very close attention to the way Ultra directs air through its internal venting system. We’ve created 3 enormous exhausts in the rear to ensure hot air gets pushed out helping to keep the rider cool whether on a commute or on a training session.
We’ve already done the initial crash tests on our beta units and they pass with plenty of safety margin to spare. We’re confident that Ultra will be one of the safest helmets on road even without the lights on. 
When you ride, you must be prepared to ride in any weather. That's why Ultra is built to IPX6 standards, to withstand the elements and keep you riding bright, come rain or shine.
We've worked really hard to improve the weight of our smart helmets. By using more efficient manufacturing methods, we were able to use less material without compromising the high level of protection that our helmets provide. Our very first helmet weighed in at 490 grams, Ultra is estimated to have a final weight of 370 grams. Now that's a big win (or loss).
There are multiple benefits to wearing lights high up on the head. Firstly, it makes it possible to be seen more clearly by motorists on the road. You're less likely to encounter a situation where your lights are being blocked by parked cars or other things on the road. Secondly, by illuminating your head, it's much easier for motorists to see where you're looking and thus know approach more carefully.
For Kickstarter, we've decided to go crazy with colors. The beauty of pre-launching Ultra is that we get to lock down the exact quantities of colors and sizes so that we can optimise production, and therefore create more variants and ensure you find the perfect one.
The colors you see here are likely going to be limited to just Kickstarter. After the campaign ends, many of the colors here will NOT make it to retail. So if you see a color you like, now may be the only time to get it.
We will be gathering feedback throughout the campaign on what colors our backers would like to see. We have a few ideas already, such as metallic colors, country colors and possibly even 2-tone colors that change with different viewing angles. Stay tuned :D
Ultra is the helmet for everyone, from kids to even bigger kids. It is available in the sizes S, M-L and XL, and they are all equipped with a click-dial fit system to ensure that Ultra sits firmly yet comfortably on your head.
Small (S): 51- 55 cm
Medium to Large (M-L): 54- 61 cm
Extra Large (XL): 61- 65 cm
PLAY

PLAY

Despite starting with a design brief of creating the successor to the wildly popular Kickstart helmet, but at half the cost, the design of Ultra has been a labour of love. We could’ve just taken the simpler approach of cutting costs from the Kickstart helmet, but we wanted to create a helmet that takes all of our learnings from building smart wearables and push the limits of helmet design to completely new heights. We’ve agonized over all the small details refining them to the point where they’d feel more at home on a $200+ helmet.
Just a few of the things we’ve considered include a design that’s not too overstated, yet exudes style. We’ve taken an even more focused user-centric approach to consider useful extras such as the sun visor and overall weight, as well as taking a keen interest in venting to help keep the head cool on more demanding rides. We’re super stoked about how the design has progressed over Ultra’s development cycle, and know that our customers will appreciate the attention to detail once they get the product in their hands.
From sketches, to CAD, to 3D printed models and design validation beta prototypes, we are now in the final stages of the design process. We are collecting tons of valuable feedback and are working on refinements to release the perfect product. With each new version, we get closer to the ultimate helmet for cycling.
PLAY

We've completed our beta testing phase. These are some of the pictures and feedback we've gotten from our beta testers. 
Better styling, amazing air flow and a shockingly lower price. Lumos Ultra really deserves the name, and frankly should be selling like hot cakes. The Lumos Ultra shows how the brand has matured from its Kickstarter roots into an established and innovative company. — James Gill, Nuneaton UK
Honestly having lights on your helmet is life changing.. The thing I like best is that if I have any doubt about whether a driver has seen me, I can look at them or their rear view mirror and know the light will flash right at them. — Caterina Buizza, London, UK
Not only will you will be investing in your safety, but you will also be getting a premium helmet. Ultra is light and breathable. It’s innovative, giving you THAT thing that other helmets are missing. I love how it looks awesome and really feels great. — Francisco Garcia, New York
For anyone that was on the fence with the previous products due to price, hopefully this new version makes the decision much easier. Just as effective as the previous versions in terms of safety (see and be seen), but with a sleek new design and more accessible price point? What’s not to like….! — John Yu, San Francisco
This is by far the best helmet if you want great protective gear, slick looks -and- lights. With the lights on your head they are above car roofs so they can always be seen. The cool look, the ventilation and the lightweight, non-bothering fit makes this my A+ choice for my 100 k per day commute as well as for ride my race bike or going on trails with my kids. — Henrik Becker, Germany
I love the concept of the Lumos helmet. I’m pretty sure my previous Lumos helmet saved my life before. The Ultra feels like a totally normal helmet. The price is reasonable for any helmet and it looks like a helmet I would buy even if it didn’t have lights. Throw in the lights and it’s totally a no-brainer! Everyone should have one! — David Rolfe, San Francisco
It’s obvious that Lumos Ultra was built on love and experience.
I have been following Lumos products since the first helmet came out on Kickstarter, and I believe the Ultra is the best one yet. It looks really cool, is super comfortable to wear, and feels very light on my head. As a surgeon, I have to go to the hospital at odd hours, lots of midnights and early mornings.. Since I’ve had the Ultra helmet, I am more confident in cycling to work. The bright lights and turn signals makes me feel more visible on the road, and visible is safe! In broad daylight, the smooth design and good-looking colors turns a lot of heads! — Petra Wahjoepramono, Indonesia
Are you are looking for a helmet that gives you the best protection both day and night? Look no further! Lumos Ultra is lightweight, high quality, durable and has the most awesome front and tail lights customization that other similar helmets only can only dream of. — Stijn Buyse, Belgium
This is the Tesla of bike helmets. Style functionality, safety features and comfort. It’s unlike any helmet I have seen on the road. This is the future of bike helmets. — Grant Leslie, Australia
Note: 
This timeline is for the first batch of Lumos Ultra with and without MIPS, size M-L.  
We estimate that sizes S and XL will be shipped out starting from Jan 2021. This is because the factory has a limited production capacity per month in order to control a high level of quality. Therefore we will be focusing on getting the more popular M-L sizes out first. 
As this is an estimate, timelines may get pushed up or pushed back but we will give our 100% to make sure that things are completed on, or even ahead of schedule. 
At the end of the campaign, we will send you a Backerkit survey via email.
From there, you will be able to choose your: Color, MIPS-add on, size, visor and other add-ons we might release throughout the campaign.
Color
The beauty of choosing your colors at the end of the campaign, is that you will be able to choose from all the new colors that we release at each stage of the campaign.
Note: Many of the colors we are making for the Kickstarter will NOT be available for retail. If you see a color combination you really like, now might be the ONLY time to get it. 
MIPS
If you have already purchased the Lumos Ultra MIPS reward, you will not need to add MIPS in the survey. It will be assigned to you automatically.
However, if you have bought the standard Lumos Ultra, you will still be able to purchase the MIPS add-on for the difference in price between the rewards.
Size
We will be launching Ultra in small (S), medium to large (M-L) and extra large sizes (XL) so that anyone from kids to adults can have an Ultra. You will be able to choose the size you want through the Backerkit survey we send you at the end of the campaign.
Visor
You will also be able to add on the attachable visor if you decide that you need one for your daily ride. The visor will retail for $25, but for this campaign, we are launching it at only $14.95.
Other add-ons
We are currently working on some Lumos merchandise, ranging from other cycling gear to everyday wear items. Once we lock down the designs and start building prototypes, we will share them with you! You will also be able to buy these add-ons through the Backerkit survey.
Shipping, Taxes (and VAT) will be calculated and paid for towards the end of the campaign, before we ship the helmets out to you. During these uncertain times, shipping costs have gone up significantly, however, we do believe that the prices will go down as the situation gets better globally.
Hence, we do not think charging shipping right now, upon pledging is at the interest of our supporters as the prices today might be more expensive than that in a few months time.
Here are our estimates of what shipping would be. 
* Prices do not include taxes and VAT. That will be subject to the laws and regulations of each individual country.
 ** Note that these prices are dependent on the situation and may increase or decrease by a few dollars in the months to come.
"I don't see my country as a shipping option" : If you do not see your country as a shipping option, it means that we currently do not offer shipping to that country. However, do send us an email if you are from a country that is not shown above, we'd love to know about it. If enough of you request for it such that it makes sense logistically to ship to that country, we will add it as an option later. 





 This project is promoted by Jellop, the ad tech power behind the best Kickstarters with 1,100+ successful Kickstarter projects with over $460M raised between them.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Unlike most Kickstarter campaigns, Lumos actually has a working, mass production ready early prototype of the product (Lumos Ultra). We believe in making the best product possible and we will be making some big improvements to the design and functionality of the helmet. This means that not only will we definitely deliver the product to you, we will also deliver a product that has been perfected though all the feedback we've gotten from the early prototype we mass produced. 

The Lumos team have been designing and manufacturing smart helmets for the last 5 years, and we have gotten pretty good at it. We also have very reputable and highly qualified manufacturing partners that we've been working with for the last few years.

So we feel that the risks of us not delivering a great working product as shown above, is close to zero. We are extremely confident and dedicated in delivering our products to everyone who needs one. 

However, it is important to understand that unexpected things may happen along the way, which are very hard to predict now. For example, delays in shipping can occur due to factors like viruses, travel restrictions or even, trade wars. 

If any delays were to occur due to such circumstances, we will definitely consistently update all our backers with full transparency and of course, aid you with any of the doubts you have along the way.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
campaign.env:
Environmental commitments
Visit our Environmental Resources Center to learn how Kickstarter encourages sustainable practices.
Long-lasting design
We have designed Ultra to be water resistant, so that it can handle all weather conditions you bring it to. 

We have also chosen the highest quality electronics in the market. We have tested a large range of electronics, and ensured that the components chosen to build Ultra have survived and surpassed levels of usage that is way above that of the final product.
Environmentally friendly factories
We have made sure that the factory that we are working with are all abiding by the rules and regulations of the government to ensure that all waste is either recycled or disposed off correctly.
Sustainable Distribution
This isn't our first rodeo. Choosing the right distribution partners is essential to keeping things within budget.
