campaign.story:
This documentary will be our love-letter to the Sci-Fi films we grew up with; the films that dared to ask, "what if?" and offered us a vision of future technology, society, and culture that simultaneously delighted, amazed and scared us.
We still remember the magic of seeing these films for the first time, and we’ve been trying to recapture that feeling ever since. Vader’s redemption, Ripley’s duel with the Alien Queen, Roy Batty’s “Tears in Rain”, and many more. Moments that surprised us. Moments that moved us. Moments that left a lasting impact on our subconscious. Years later, we’re still trying to recapture these transformative experiences. 
We are making this documentary to celebrate, explore, and recontextualise these films and the influence they’ve had both on ourselves and our culture. We want to go beyond the movies, to the science, technology, and art they’ve inspired. This documentary will be a time capsule, capturing unheard stories and perspectives not just for us, but for future generations.
We want to do this project for all these reasons, and for the simplest one of all – because when the lights go down, we’re all kids again.
In Search of Tomorrow Movie Poster by Clayton Benge
In Search of Tomorrow will take viewers on a year-by-year deep dive into the many awe-inspiring worlds of ‘80s Sci-Fi movies, breaking down the most iconic and eccentric films you know and love (and many you may have forgotten or missed), and examining the science, technology, and artistry behind the fiction.
The completed feature will be more than four hours long and feature insights and anecdotes from an extensive collection of experts and iconic talent, including filmmakers, actors, special-effects and visual effects masters, tech advisors, authors, influencers, and visionaries. Not only will they tell their own stories, but they will share opinions about their own favorite Sci-Fi movies.
Through our interviews with ‘80s Sci-Fi masters and subject-matter experts we want to explore a wide range of issues, including:
 Heroes and Heroines: Hear from the actors, writers, directors, and producers who brought Sci-Fi icons such as Rick Deckard, Ellen Ripley, and the Terminator to your movie screen.
 SFX Breakdowns: Learn how your favorite robot, creature, and spaceship effects were created. We’ll be interviewing the artists who designed and operated the models, puppets, and animatronics that brought some of your favorite creatures and characters to life.
 Production Design & Worldbuilding: Learn about the creation of the costumes, weapons, and post-apocalyptic landscapes that set the scene for our favorite stories.
 Socio/Political Context: How ‘80s Sci-Fi reflected the socio-political context in which it was made: Tech advances, Reaganomics, Live AID, big business, and the AIDS crisis.
 Genre Mixing: Exploring how other genres - fantasy, action, horror, and comedy - are very much intertwined with the Sci-Fi genre. Where does one begin and the other end?
 Legacy: Discuss the importance of ‘80s Sci-Fi genre in a modern-day context. Why is ‘80s Sci-Fi still so relevant today?
  Our last Kickstarter project, In Search of Darkness, successfully shipped to more than 25,000 backers and customers. This project - a four-hour-plus epic on the ‘80s horror movie genre - received critical-acclaim, was nominated for Best Documentary at the Rondo Hatton Awards, and received an incredible reception from fans.
This time we’re going to do even better.
We’ve already been working on In Search of Tomorrow for a year and we’ve signed up some incredible names to our cast including Sean Young (Rachael in Blade Runner, Chani in Dune), Henry Thomas (Elliott in E.T.), Sam J. Jones (Flash Gordon in Flash Gordon), and Lance Guest (Alex in The Last Starfighter) - and we’re adding more all the time. Check out the cast list below to see the 50 names already attached to the project.
These fantastic contributors have put their faith in our vision by attaching their name to our project - we hope you will do the same. Your support will go towards the cost of production, filming interviews, and post-production. This Kickstarter is an essential stage to realizing our vision and we can’t do it without you - and we wouldn’t want to.
Back now to get your name in the credits and help us make the ultimate ‘80s Sci-Fi documentary. Rewards include a free digital copy of In Search of Darkness (ships 05/19), for those who haven’t backed us in the past, and a special Pin for backers who have backed either In Search of the Last Action Heroes or In Search of Darkness. 
In addition to your physical rewards, you will receive access to our exclusive online Discord community for backers. This community will become your second home as you discuss your favorite ‘80s Sci-Fi films, follow the documentary’s progress, and partake in a range of exciting members-only activities.
We’ve been running this community with a small selection of supporters for several months and it has been enormously popular. We can’t wait to invite our backers in: this is the place where there will always be someone ready to discuss your favorite ‘80s Sci-Fi films.
Check out our community trailer to hear from a few of our founding members:
Features include:
 Watch Parties - We regularly gather online to sync up our films and watch old favorites together whilst participating in a group conversation about the movie. Love watching films with friends? It’s like that - only online.
   Special Guest Q&As - We invite experts to talk with us on specific aspects of ‘80s Sci-Fi. You’ll learn about filmmaking, worldbuilding, and hear behind-the-scenes stories from your favorite films. These will be in-depth and full of information that would be impossible to find elsewhere
   Interact With Our Team - Our team is very active in the community and we look forward to meeting you and discussing ‘80s Sci-Fi and In Search of Tomorrow with you. This is your opportunity to join the journey as we build this documentary.
   Shape The Future of the Documentary - As a member of our community, we’ll be relying on you to provide opinions on why you love certain films and to give feedback on rough-cuts of our documentary. This is your chance to get involved, contribute, and help us make it the best documentary possible.
Please note: Access will be granted to the community once the campaign has concluded (05/19)
In addition to your invite you will also receive our Community Starter Guide, a special PDF document we’ve created to onboard you to the project, provide you with more detail about what we’re planning for In Search of Tomorrow, and help you to start getting involved and providing feedback on the project.
The Community Starter Guide will include:
Foreword from Executive Producer and CreatorVC CEO Robin Block
Welcome Letter from Director David Weiner
Full, Highly-Detailed Synopsis for In Search of Tomorrow
How to get started on Discord and start interacting with other members
Community rules and guidelines
  Back now to receive access to our exclusive backer community and your Community Starter Guide from 05/19. Backers at the Rick Deckard (Associate Producer) tier and above will also get access to our Top Backers Channel.
In addition to the documentary itself (Digital, Factory-Pressed DVD, or Factory-Pressed Blu-Ray) we have a wide range of physical rewards to thank our backers for their support. Please check the below section ‘Pledge Tiers’ to see which rewards are available at which level.

Regardless of the level of funding we receive through this Kickstarter, we are committed to finishing our documentary. So why should you get involved now?
 Get It First - Our Kickstarter backers will be the first to receive their documentary and rewards, ahead of all other customers.
 Community - We are committed to providing incredible value through our online community. The watch parties, special guest Q&As, interaction with our team, and the opportunity to input on the future of the documentary . Customers who buy after launch won’t be able to experience these same benefits.
 Join The Journey - Follow the process of creating the documentary from beginning to end. You’ll be the first to hear casting news, get to share your thoughts on your favorite ‘80s Sci-Fi films, and will also get access to rough-cuts as we build the documentary.
 Help Make Documentary a Success - Your early support will help ensure the documentary is a success. By backing us now, we can use the funds you pledge to make a documentary that does justice to the movies we love and the people that made them.
Ready join the journey? Choose your pledge level now!
Never used Kickstarter before? No problem! Backing our project is easy. Just follow these three simple steps:
 Step 1: Choose your reward level from those shown above and then select that reward in the sidebar to the right (it should say ‘Select this reward’ when you hover your mouse over it).
 Step 2: Choose your country and then fill out the rest of your information.
 Step 3: Click “Pledge” and get ready to join an incredible journey!
Once the campaign is complete, we will send out your invitation to the community, your free Digital Edition of In Search of Darkness (all tiers except Marty McFly Tier), and your Community Starter Guide. Physical rewards will be made available once the documentary is complete - we’ve scheduled the release date for July 2021.
Please note: Your card will only be charged once the campaign is complete (assuming our project reaches its minimum funding goal) so you will not see it on your statement when you first make a pledge.
In Search of Tomorrow has been in pre-production for a year already. Casting will continue throughout 2020 with filming planned to begin in the Autumn. Kickstarter backers will receive their items first and we are planning for a July 2021 release.
Our physical rewards are manufactured and shipped from the United States. Backers will receive a tracking number and our items are sent in very study packaging (posters rolled, not folded) to ensure everything arrives with you safely.
Because shipping costs vary substantially depending on whether you are in the US or Rest of World, we have decided not to include shipping costs in the pledge tiers. Instead, shipping costs are as follows:
USA - £7 (approx. $8.80)
UK - £12 (approx. $15)

We are an independent producer of community-powered entertainment: long-form factual content that is funded, inspired, and shaped by a dedicated community of fans. Our projects include the critically acclaimed documentaries In Search of the Last Action Heroes and In Search of Darkness and the upcoming In Search of Tomorrow.

We’ve partnered with our friends at New Retro Wave again to curate our official soundtrack. NewRetroWave is one of the leading voices in the emerging Retrowave scene, providing exposure to Retrowave artists who perfectly match the ‘80s aesthetic we’re celebrating.
Our soundtrack for In Search of Darkness was a huge success, reaching #5 on the electronic music Billboard Chart. We can’t wait to hear this one!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
As with any documentary, there are risks and challenges that may arise over the course of the production of this film. Our past experience funding, producing, and distributing documentaries, plus the year’s work we’ve already put in, means we are very confident of meeting our backer’s expectations - however, unforeseen delays are possible.

While many countries are in lockdown, due to COVID-19, we cannot start filming interviews with our growing cast. Our July release date does take this into account, but if the lockdown were to continue throughout the year we might experience a small delay to the shipping date. As always, we will keep backers fully updated regarding the situation and they will know well in advance if there is likely to be a delay.

If you were a backer of our previous project, you will know that we experienced delays with manufacturing and shipping for that product. This was due to mistakes we made when choosing a distribution partner, which led to us making a switch. We now have a very reliable US-based partner and do not anticipate further problems in this area.

TERMS & CONDITIONS

We have accurately portrayed our project as it stands at this point in time, however, creative projects are subject to change and ours is no exception. By making a pledge you acknowledge that elements of the project, including but not limited to the artwork, cast, and content, is subject to change, and that the final project may differ from what is presented while the Kickstarter campaign is active.

All backers are welcome to join our community, but to do so they must conform to the community rules which govern appropriate behavior. Repeated failure to act appropriately in the community will result in a ban.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

In the last post I put one too many r's in the email.  Our email is guerrillapublishinggroup@gmail.com

At this point other than the pins (whose production is tied up due to the current pandemic) everyone who filled out a survey should have gotten their rewards.  If you have not, please contact us to let us know at guerrrillapublishinggroup@gmail.com

First I want to apologize about the lack of communication about the pins.  Ben has been posting updates about them on his social media, but we have not included the information here.  The pins are coming from China and are held up due to the COVID crisis.  They will be shipped out separately when they come in.  We would love to give you an eta, but at this moment we really do not know.  That is why we shipped rewards without out them, so you would have most of your rewards without waiting.

So, I am still waiting on the stickers.  There might need to be a change in our future campaigns who we work with.  In the past the company has always been very professional, but right now they are not acting like it.  I am told that they are supposed to be done this week.  As soon as they are, the rest of Gunwork rewards will be shipped out.   Pins will be shipped out separately as  

Secondly, we are currently running a kickstarter for our horror anthology, Tales From the Cryptic Closet Vol 2.  We have met our goal and first stretch goal.  We are now working on our second stretch goal.  There's some really cool stuff there.  Check it out if you are interested.

As many of you know we call our company Guerrilla Publishing.  So the name on this Kickstarter account will be changing from Ben Miller to Guerrilla Publishing.  Everything will remain the same.  Rewards will still be shipped to those that are waiting for them.

So the books are in.  The first round of books were shipped out today.  Stickers and T-shirts should be in within the next few weeks.  As those rewards come in, those tiers will be shipped out.  The pins are delayed due to the ongoing pandemic.  However they will be shipped separately at a later date.  I want to thank all of you for your patience with this project, and I hope you enjoy the book.

June 19th we will be launching the #kickstarter for Tales from the Cryptic Closet 2!!! This 80 page horror anthology  will feature some returning creatives and some new creatives to stir up  some of your darkest nightmares. Make sure to mark your calendars this  is one that you sure don't want to miss.

campaign.story:
Rick, a small time crook in Los Angeles, becomes an unlikely hero in the mystical battle between good and evil which has been fought since the days of Ancient China. And Rick is an angry, unfocused fight club member who is barely equipped to deal with…well…anything. Fans of action and comedy who like Shang-Chi, Army of Darkness, Big Trouble in Little China and even ’80s buddy comedies should all find something to like here.
160 pages of epic fights, Chinese Mythology, sinister villains and mouthy heroes.  
I've always been a fan of genre hopping. Some of my favorite movies, TV shows, and comics have all had genres mixing together. Army of Darkness, Buffy the Vampire Slayer, Sandman, Guardians of the Galaxy, and of course, Big Trouble in Little China. But I also loved it when there was more going on. Like, in Buffy, you're laughing, there's a jump scare, but then there's also a poignant moment to reflect on the nature of human emotion. Why not have everything? So I wanted to create a story that was funny, exciting and action packed. But I also wanted to create something that explored human connection, and the relationships we have with family, friends, and partners. And also how anger and violence can destroy those human connections. But it still needed to have roundhouse kicks, magic, monsters, giants and dragons. Truth. 
During the soft launch we were going to go all digital. Man, that went over like a palm strike to the nose. So we heard you, and we added a physical printing to the tiers! You spoke, we listened. That did change our budget since we had already launched, so we have to add the shipping costs separately after the campaign via BackerKit. 
We'll also have great ADD-ONS like physical copies of Long Ago and Far Away, Ear Buds: The Podcasting Documentary DVD, The Comedy Film Nerds Guide to Movies, and maybe even a few surprises... 
Also, the digital rewards will be fulfilled by ComiXology, so they'll go seamlessly right into your collection!
It was also important to me to give you the whole story. I didn't want to break up this project into multiple issues and kickstarter campaigns. That's why the goal is higher. We're not doing multiple issues or chapters. This is the whole 160-page story all together in one graphic novel.
 TEAM: We got the band back together, and it will be the same creative team from Long Ago and Far Away:  Click the links for more info!
Creator/Writer: CHRIS MANCINI (Comedy Film Nerds, Pacify Me: A Handbook for the Freaked Out New Dad, Ear Buds: The Podcasting Documentary)

campaign.story:
WELCOME!
My name is Clay McCormack, comic book artist (Poser, Redline, Night Moves), and I'm here to bring you my first creator-owned graphic novel project:
BLOODY HEL 
Well there's something you don't see every day! (BLOODY HEL cover)
BLOODY HEL is the story of 5 mystically-powered Viking warriors, imprisoned for 1000 years by the goddess Hel, who are suddenly unleashed when their prison is destroyed by an artillery shell from World War I. 
So they burst out, 9-feet tall, all juiced up on magic and nearly invincible, and start wreaking havoc during the first world war!
We see this all through the eyes of Pvt. Lars Andersen. He's a British soldier, basically just a cog in the massive war machine, waiting for his turn to die. Anderson is brought face to face with the Viking god Fenrir, who's opened up a pit of demons out in no man's land in an attempt to bring about the VIKING APOCALYPSE. 
It's now up to Andersen to convince the 5 Viking warriors to use their new powers to stop Fenrir's plans, and to show them that ruling a world of war is just ruling a world of ash. Ultimately, BLOODY HEL is a story about power: how it can be seductive and corrupting when you have it, and how you can dig deep to find it when you don’t.

THE BOOK
BLOODY HEL is going to be a beautiful over-sized (7.5"x11") hardcover graphic novel written and drawn by me, Clay McCormack (Night Moves, Poser, Redline, Cafe Racer), with an exquisite color palette of blood and mud provided by rising star Russ Badgett. 
We've already partnered with a great comics publisher called A Wave Blue World (Dead Beats, All We Ever Wanted, This Nightmare Kills Fascists) who will be putting the book out for us, and we just need YOUR HELP to get the funds to make BLOODY HEL a reality! 
We've also got a pin up section that is going to make this book visually stunning, featuring contributions by some of comics' best artists - including a piece by Batman: White Knight artist Sean Murphy, which will also be available in our rewards section as an exclusive dust jacket cover!
Black and White art for Sean's pin up/dust jacket - final version will be full color!
 PIN UP ART!
Bloody Hel Pin Up by Christian DiBari
Bloody Hel Pin Up art by Corin Howell
Bloody Hel Pin Up Art - Astrior the Shield Maiden - by Tana Ford
Bloody Hel pin up art by Jorge Coelho
Valdemar pin up image by Ricardo Lopez-Ortiz
REWARDS!
There's a slew of great rewards available for backers of BLOODY HEL, including the book itself in hard copy and digital formats, an MP3 Soundtrack Download, exclusive prints from myself and Sean Murphy, original art, and even your name or likeness to be featured in the book! In addition, all backers at the $5 level and higher will have their name printed in the "Thank You" section of the book!  



We also have a limited "Early Bird Special" deal that features a copy of the book with an original drawing inside for only $39 (normally $59) - this is the best value version of the book and it's first come, first serve, so when they're gone, they're gone (Early Bird Special is now gone)! 
FINALLY
Making comics is hard, expensive, time consuming work, but one thing I know my team and I can do is make comics. GREAT comics. The funds from this campaign will give us the ability to put our full attention toward making this book the best it can be, covering art/coloring costs, printing and shipping rewards, Kickstarter fees, and most importantly supplying us with the knowledge that there is an enthusiastic readership out there who want to read BLOODY HEL as badly as we want to make it!
THANK YOU FOR YOUR SUPPORT!
(Very special thanks to Jim Galdos for an amazing video. Jim's website )
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is my first Kickstarter, but I've backed enough to know that communication and transparency are key to building trust among your audience. That's why I'll be offering frequent updates, not just during the campaign, but during the creation of the work itself, to insure that you know exactly what is going on every step of the way.

The biggest challenge of a project like this is creating it, and actually getting the book into peoples hands, which is why I've partnered with A Wave Blue World. They're a publisher with an excellent track record as far as product quality goes, and their editorial insight will make sure the project runs smoothly, is delivered on time, and is a book you'll be glad you have in your collection.

campaign.story:
Buy GameBender and get more Info at GameBender.com 


GameBender is a radical new coding system, where you modify and code games while you play them.
Code with tools, almost like Photoshop or filters for coding.
Follow a code card to write your first snippet of code. You just coded a glitch that you can apply to any game. 
It unleashes wild creativity during gameplay, and allows a path into coding that looks more like a party or an art class and less like homework.   
Millions of coded Scratch projects are now available on GameBender. The founder of GameBender helped launch Scratch in 2007 at MIT. Scratch is the most popular visual "blocks" coding language for beginners. 
Every game is shared by individual creators around the world, so you can play millions of games for free.
There is more diversity in the types of games and contributors on Scratch and Game Bender than any other game console.
Play platformers and puzzle games just like a normal system, but also "indie" style games made by people like you.
Bring yourself into the game. 
Turn any game into a full body augmented reality experience.
 In addition to games, there are also apps and DIY TV shows.
Next, see how you can blur the line between playing and creating. 
We dreamed of a game system that was infinitely flexible, yet as easy to use as a pair of scissors. We thought, "What would game scissors, game glue, code spray paint, and even a medicine dropper full of game code be like? Is that even possible?" 
Game Filters let you change a whole game at once, almost like an Instagram filter for games.
Glitches let you be a game designer. Insert new characters, assign powers, and cast magic spells, almost like Photoshopping a game. 
Inject a unicorn cannon and warp portals. Switch places with anyone. Clone objects. Apply visual filters to characters.  
Changing the game is the new way to "play the game." More than 50 glitches are included with GameBender. Here are a few more examples.
Glitch cards guide you through the game bending process from the beginning. 
Learn how glitches work with these simple Glitch Cards. Play them as a card game. While you are playing a video game, your friend throws glitch cards down to help or hinder.
Gaming with these new creative tools shifts the addictive side of gaming onto your own awesome creativity, which leads to a feeling of power and a desire to dive deeper. 
Coding lessons often fall flat because they don't start with what's awesome, and because many children don't learn well in isolation. The GameBender approach doesn't start with "learning to code," instead it immerses the children as a group in a truly engaging world, a world in which code is the currency for doing new things.
Follow a code card to write your first snippet of code. You just created a glitch that you can apply to any game. 
Learn how code works with these simple Code Cards
The 25 code cards come with Code Class 101, which walks you through making your first glitches and your first games.
Code Immersion: See the code inside everything using the code button on the controller. 
Social Coding: Kids love sharing their creations with each other, and learning by playing, shoulder to shoulder.  
Step into coding: Can just playing and bending games lead to coding?
Just by playing you are already learning that games can be coded by people like you. Next you might apply a 1-click filter, or use a glitch tool, and you will see the code flying into the characters, giving you your first sense of coding intuition. Before you know it you are tweaking variables live while you play and following code cards to write your own code. You can code your first game in minutes.
See how our philosophy of "Play. Bend. Code." comes together in a workshop:
We believe everyone is an inventor. Get a GameBender and let's reinvent the digital world!
With either reward, artists, engineers, and kids can play, bend, and code, and enter a new era of gaming by the people. Digital media belongs to us.

We have shipped over 1 million hardware units including 2 successful Kickstarters over the last decade. This will be our most challenging product yet. The key risks are software integration, supply chain management, and global shipping logistics. Estimating development time for a software project of this scale is always a challenge. Our partner, Bocoup, has conducted extensive roadmapping and time estimates, however exact velocity can be difficult to predict. Supply chain presents numerous detailed risks, and although we are familiar with overseas manufacturing, GameBender has multiple suppliers. Delays could be introduced if vendors don't meet our specifications or schedule. Global shipping logistics can have setbacks due to customs, congestion, and holiday volume. While we are planning for typical delays in shipping, multiple delays could compound to impact our ability to get GameBender onto your doorstep in line with our estimate. Finally, if we were to far exceed backing expectations, scaling a level of magnitude in manufacturing could multiply the above risks as shipping and manufacturing factors can vary significantly at different production scales.

updates.update_content: On May 24th, 2019, we announced our new company, GameBender. The soul of GameBender is our mission "The World is a Construction Kit." We encapsulated this mission over the last 4 years in GameBender OS (software that lets you create and modify games, apps, and DIY TV shows, while you play). We were so excited to share it with the community that we followed quickly by launching this campaign for our first product, a game console with GameBender OS inside. Today, we are going to end our Kickstarter campaign early, and we are not taking any pledges. We will carry forward with GameBender OS in a new form factor. Our company lives on and the mission never ends. We will come back soon with an even better offering. This campaign has been helpful for our team and strengthened GameBender’s path forward.

campaign.story:
BauBax Pants feel  light and will not weigh you down. No more saggy pants that drop due to their own weight. Travel light! 
Our pants pack small when rolled so you can carry more. Pro tip: Since our pants can go days without a wash, go on, carry those extra shoes you always wanted to wear! 
We didn't want you to have a polka dot pant when an unexpected drizzle came around. So we made them water resistant. 
We know spills happen, especially when you are on your 4th drink, joyously banging those glasses to cheers the viking way, thats why we made them stain resistant! Be it coffee, beer, wine, soda, cocktails, our pants allow you to walk away without a stain. You can practically walk to work in them after partying all night! 
Please note: Our pants do not offer stain resistance against oils, ketchup, sriracha sauce or any oil-based liquids. 
After sitting on those long, cramped, uncomfortable flights don't you feel like stretching out, doing some Yoga maybe? Well now you can. Our dynamic stretch technology allows you to stretch your hearts out!
Stretchability varies across our pant styles. Pants in the above photo are Trouser Leggings. 
Breathe in - Breathe out .... thats what our pants do all the time. Allowing your skin to breathe while keeping you fresh like a daisy!
Our pants offer odor control, allowing you to wear them without a wash for up to 3 days.
Because all our pants are Teflon treated, they will absorb less odor and stains. Thus, they can and should be washed less frequently.
We get it. You want more pockets, but cargos are not your thing. With thoughtfully placed pockets you can go from a hike to an elite restaurant without a change. Whats more? we made your pockets secure and deep. The zippered pockets give you a secure way to carry things that could easily slide out on a plane when you are catching some zzZZZZz. Deep pockets allow you to carry more than just keys. To give you that sophisticated look we have designed pockets that blend in with each style. Check out our Color and Details section below to get a better look!
Travel and the sun go hand in hand and we have got you covered quite literally. BauBax pants are UPF 50+ so you can go out and enjoy the sun! That means they only allow 1/50th of those harmful rays through. (Blocking 98% of the other UV rays). Whats more? all of this comes without any use of harmful chemicals which are found in most sunscreens. So go ahead you sun flower! Beam Away!
Although natural fibers like Merino Wool and Bamboo are strong, they need a little help from Polyester for structure and durability which ensures your pant stays as good as new.
This unique property of Bamboo is why we decided to go for Bamboo over Cotton. Bamboo viscose is 3X more absorbent than most cotton fibers, and can take in three times more water than its weight which once made into a fabric, means that it can absorb tons of moisture.
Merino Wool on the outside helps wick away the moisture that the Bamboo has absorbed on the inside. The combined action of Bamboo Viscose and Merino Wool helps keep you dry, fresh, and comfortable.
Mother nature has given sheep the perfect clothing to keep them comfortable all year round be it summer or winter. 
Warming: Wool's natural crimped shape helps it trap air better than any other fiber. Static air is a great insulator and provides resistance against the cold. 
Cooling: Wool has the ability to store moisture within the structure of the fiber. As your body warms up, the moisture stored within the fiber will begin to evaporate, cooling the air between your skin and the fabric. The warmer you get the more evaporation takes place and the larger the cooling effect
Merino wool is super fine, yet it can cause an itch to those with sensitive skin. Hence, we smartly put Bamboo closer to your skin and Merino on the outside - to Ditch the Itch and still enjoy the rich benefits of Merino Wool. 
For those times when you are on the road, we have got good news for you. BauBax pants are naturally quick to dry thanks to the wicking features of Bamboo Viscose and Merino Wool. 
Because all our pants are Teflon treated, they will absorb less odor and stains. Thus, they can and should be washed less frequently.
CARE: Wash with like colors with mild detergent cold. Tumble dry low or lay flat or line dry. Do not use fabric softener during wash as this may damage the water repellency. Do NOT bleach. Do NOT dry clean.
DOMESTIC SHIPPING - To 33 Countries:
United States, Canada, Australia, Singapore, Hong Kong, and 28 EU Countries: Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Croatia, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Ireland, Italy, Latvia, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, United Kingdom
We've got 6 warehouses worldwide that allow us to offer low-cost domestic shipping to the 33 countries listed above. Backers with a shipping address in any of these 33 countries will NOT have to pay any additional duties, sales tax, VAT, etc. We've got that covered!
*INTERNATIONAL SHIPPING - Rest of the World:
Backers from all other countries (apart from the 33 countries listed above) may have to pay additional import duties or other applicable taxes to the concerned authorities upon receipt of their goods - depending on the import policies of their respective countries. The duties and tax rates vary from country to country and we are unable to help you determine that for your shipment. If you wish to learn about the duties and taxes applicable to your shipment, you may want to check with the customs and border protection authority of your country.  
From our prior experiences, we have learned that most of the countries have higher thresholds for import duties and most of our international customers should not get charged any additional fees apart.

La Voz De Mayo Cover by J. Gonzo
A resonant, neglected slice of American history is told for the first time, in graphic-novel format. Featuring art by Jason “Gonzo” Gonzalez, edited by Claire Napier, and script and lettering by me, Henry Barajas: journalist, comedian, author, native Tucsonan, and great-grandson of the story’s main character, Tata Rambo, aka Ramon Jaurigue. 
La Voz De Mayo (Page 1) by J. Gonzo
La Voz De M.A.Y.O. is the true story of Ramon Jaurigue, an orphan and WWII veteran who co-founded the Mexican, American, Yaqui, and Others (M.A.Y.O.) organization, which successfully lobbied the Tucson City Council to improve living and working conditions for members of the local Pascua Yaqui tribe. Largely due to Ramon’s activism, both in M.A.Y.O. in and with Model Cities Program, Yaqui were successfully integrated into the expanding metropolis of Tucson: families bought property, roads and sidewalks were built, and sewage systems installed. Ramon and his colleagues even founded a night school to help adults learn English and established the region’s first low-cost clinic to offer birth control.
La Voz De Mayo (Page 4) by J. Gonzo
Untiring in their efforts for equal rights and opportunities, Ramon and M.A.Y.O.eventually secured official U.S. government recognition for the Pascua Yaqui tribe. Local government didn’t give up their plans to bridge Tucson to the west coast and taxpayer dollars to the Old Pueblo’s indigenous people without a fight. The Carter Administration was skeptical of the Yaqui’s eligibility, so it took compromise from Ramon and the tribe. While trying to keep 12,000 families together, Ramon struggled with taking care of his own family life.  
La Voz De Mayo (Page 9) by J. Gonzo
La Voz De Mayo (Page 23) by J. Gonzo
Utilizing newspaper clippings, interviews with surviving MAYO members, and Ramon’s authored articles, La Voz De M.A.Y.O. dramatizes the remarkable life and achievements of my great-grandfather—and in so doing, tells the story not just of a single man, but of a family, a tribe, a nation.
It's an honor to follow in my great-grandfather's footsteps. He was a writer in his own right by documenting what was happening in the community and trying to do something about it. I wish I could've finished this before he passed away last October. But I'm confident he was proud of my and my family's effort.

campaign.story:
Resource Manual – Molding & Casting
What: Resource Manual - Molding and Casting is a guide to the molding and casting techniques used in model animation, Television/Film production, and studio art techniques. The guide will hold building information that is important for a production or artist from basic sculpting to advanced mold making and casting techniques. 
Types of materials, techniques, and manufacturers covered in the book:
Tools Overview 
Sculpting Basics
Materials (Cements and Plasters, Latex and Silicones, Plastics and Urethanes, Gelatins, Clays and Wax, Alternative & Advanced materials)
Mold Making (Press Molds, One Part Molds, Two Part Molds, Three+ Part Molds, Matrix Molds, Vertical Techniques, Fiberglass Techniques, and More!!!)
Casting (Plastic and Urethanes, Silicones, Latex's, Gelatins, Injection Techniques, Pour Techniques, Roto-Casting, Advanced Materials & Techniques)
Manufacturers and Distributors
The Process from Beginning to End!
Why: There currently isn’t a comprehensive guide to the professional methods used in the studio for molding and casting. Sure you can find books about techniques in many different languages all over the world, but none of them go in depth about the methods and procedures used in making reproductions of models, sculptures, props, masks, and statues. The internet has a lot of conflicting information and I'm constantly being asked why a specific technique didn't work for them. There's also very few modern resource manuals that touch upon the latest more advanced techniques using materials that didn't exist 10 years ago. Lets change that and build a book filled with information for both beginners and advanced professionals who require precise step by step methods to be able to achieve pro-level results without second guessing themselves. There’s nothing more frustrating than making a piece of art that is forever distorted/destroyed by poor technique or permanently incased in a block of cement or urethane. Destroying all the hard work you've put into a piece is not an option and I want to take the guess work out of the equation for you. 
Another reason for this book is to guide individuals and studios to the manufacturers and distributors that supply the industry and also who provide services. Finding a specific material or chemical can be extremely frustrating when trying to plan, budget, and build your production. Distributors and manufacturers don’t often openly show how to use their products and if they do it’s never in the context of your needs. This book will provide a list of manufacturers/distributors along with the products which pertain to sculpting/casting, model making, mask making, prop casting along with many other methods used in reproduction of 3 dimensional art, along with how to use these materials. Want to know how to make clear casting plastic? Or what’s the difference between all those silicones and resins you see on the internet? Don’t worry the information you seek is only a click away in a handy digital copy E-book that you can access from your computer at any time.
So why a digital version and not a print version?
The real answer here is cost and content. Paper based books cost a lot of money to make and the page count and content often get limited due to this fact. Also, printing high quality color images is cost prohibitive with most book makers and prevents a well rounded guide. Add to this nothing can be “comprehensive” if it is limited by how much information it can hold. With the initial digital version of the book a page count will not restrict the production of the book and this will allow for assessment of a potential future print version. Also because it is digital the book can live on your computer, tablet, or phone for instant access. 
*This fundraiser is for production of Edition 01 which will also have various version updates as techniques are added to it over the year 2019. The final version is slotted for Fall 2019. 
When: The estimated release date for the Resource Manual (rough draft 01) is December 2018. It will be accessible for instant download. Future updates to Edition 001 will also be available throughout 2019 and the final draft will be available by Fall 2019 from the established website and will provide 24 hour access for download. 
Rewards:
-Resource Manual - The main focus of the fundraiser is to raise funds for the production of the Resource Manual. So the main reward is of course the Resource Manual – Molding & Casting, but there are a couple other rewards that you can get as well.
-Special Thanks - Get your name in the book as a special thank you for helping make this possible.
-Private Lessons with the Author -  There's a lot to be said about learning from experience and from those who have experience. I'm offering a rare opportunity to learn a little of what I know. You have a choice of a one or two hour private lessons. This can be done through Skype via a video conference call or if you are in the Los Angeles County California area are welcome to have the lessons at my studio in Pomona California. You can ask me advice, technique questions, and anything related to animation or stop motion. The time is yours and I'm here for you. 
-Sponsor the Book- There's a lot of building materials out there from tools and clays to molding and casting materials. As a manufacturer of materials and tools you know that a tutorial focused on your product is vital in insuring successful application by your customers. What better way to do this than by having a tutorial that uses your product?!?! Let's make magic together!
$5000 STRETCH GOAL - SMM Magazine 2018
If we meet the stretch goal of $5000 then every backer $15 and up will get the 2018 digital subscription of Stop Motion Magazine!!!
Stop Motion Magazine
About the Author
John Ikuma is an award winning animator, VFX artist, producer, director and publisher with 20 years of experience in television and film. He's the creator and executive editor of Stop Motion Magazine a publication dedicated to preserving the art of stop motion animation. John Ikuma is internationally recognized as an expert in stop motion animation and visual effects with having done work on productions from Fox Television, Cartoon Network, HUB Network and Disney to directing, producing, and animating on major commercials for companies such as Toy's R Us, Fiat, Benjamin Moore, and many others. He's earned 3 production Emmy's and a Latin Music Video award. His video tutorials on molding and casting have helped thousands worldwide in their pursuit of learning the art of molding and casting. With over 10 years of experience sculpting, molding, and casting John Ikuma is ready to make a book for everyone to experience the joy and fun of making art.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
It’s no mystery that life has its way of getting out of hand and sometimes this requires pumping the brakes or taking a rest to recover and lick your wounds. Since there is no printing required for the release of the resource manual there is certainly little risk in publishing issues other than hospitalization or death of the author. The biggest rick here is in the content. Having years of experience building and working professionally in television and film the content creation can and will have its bumps, but by working closely with the manufacturers of the materials involved with the production of the manual it is our hope that this production will go smoothly and be released on time. If a delay does happen then a first draft preview will still be available to guarantee that there is no delay in you getting started with making some great molds and casts.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
While we expect this campaign to run smoothly, there are always risks involved, such as:

1. We could run into production issues
2. Customs could hold shipments for a few weeks
3. Our cat could lick the ink off all the shipping labels—again (don't ask)

We’ve done our best to mitigate these risks by working with a high-end manufacturer that produces gear for major brands. We’re using well-established shipping companies. And we’ve given the cat an ink dispenser of her own (seriously, don't ask). 

If challenges do occur, rest assured we’ll do our utmost to minimize any delays and to deliver you the packing system that will have you packing like a pro.

campaign.story:
NECK PILLOW:
Built-in inflatable neck pillow, which can be easily tucked inside the hood of our jackets. Our proprietary innovative valve technology allows 2 SECOND INFLATION
Simple and easy - ONE PRESS DEFLATION
EYE MASK:
You'll always have an eye mask when you need it. Travel eye mask built inside the hood
GLOVES:
Built-in gloves that easily slide in and out of the sleeves, to keep you warm and cozy when you are on the go
TRAVEL FOOTREST:
Inflatable Travel Footrest that comes with the jacket in a dedicated pocket. Our Travel Footrests come with our proprietary innovative valve technology that allows QUICK INFLATION and easy ONE PRESS DEFLATION
TRAVEL BLANKET:
Our Travel Blanket is super lightweight but warm enough to keep you cozy during all your travels. It can be folded and stored in a pocket
TRAVEL BOTTLE:
Ever found yourself thirsty on long flights? and desperately waiting for the stewardess to start serving water? Well, not anymore! Our jacket comes with a foldable BauBax Travel Bottle that can be stored in a pocket or hung on your trouser belt loops using the carabiner
EARPLUGS:
A pair of Passive noise-reducing earplugs come with all our jackets in its dedicated pocket
APPLE PENCIL POCKET:
Now you can always carry your Apple pencil or a regular pen with a dedicated pocket for it
AIRPODS POCKET:
A dedicated pocket to carry Apple AirPods and other wireless earbuds will ensure you are never dumbfounded looking for your earphones
AIRPODS STRAPS:
Built-in straps to make sure you don't lose your Apple AirPods if they slip out of your ears, especially when you are listening to music while doing outdoor activities
POWER BANK POCKET:
Dedicated pocket to carry your portable battery bank/charger. This pocket is thoughtfully placed right below the phone pocket to conveniently allow charging of your phone right inside your jacket pocket
SUNGLASS POCKET:
With a dedicated sunglass pocket, easily carry your sunglasses or eyeglasses and always have them ready for you when you are on the go
MICROFIBER CLOTH:
PASSPORT POCKET:
TABLET POCKET:
RETRACTABLE KEYCHAIN:
A retractable keychain with a carabiner to ensure you not only carry your keys always but also not lose them. The two front pockets (hand warming pockets) have loops built-in to allow locking of the carabiner
BOTTLE OPENER + WHISTLE:
Beer Emergency? Not a problem! We've got you covered - Our retractable keychain also comes with a bottle opener, which is also a whistle that could come in handy in life-threatening situations or simply beer emergencies
DRINK POCKET:
PHONE POCKET:
WIRED EARPHONE HOLDER:
ZIPPER = PEN + STYLUS:
HAND WARMING POCKETS:
SECRET POCKET:
RFID proof secret pocket to carry your credit cards. The location of this pocket will be different in each style of our jacket and will be known only to the jacket owners - it's not public information ;)
DETACHABLE HOOD:
SIZING CHART & HOW TO MEASURE:
For sizing chart and how to measure guide, please refer to the surveys that we'll send out via BackerKit.com by early May 2018.
DOMESTIC SHIPPING - To 34 Countries:
United States, Canada, Australia, Singapore, Hong Kong, China, and 28 EU Countries: Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Croatia, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Ireland, Italy, Latvia, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, United Kingdom
We've got 7 Warehouses worldwide that allow us to offer domestic shipping at highly discounted rates to the 34 countries listed above. Backers with a shipping address in any of these 34 countries will NOT have to pay any additional fees and taxes (apart from the nominal domestic shipping fees that we charge when you make your pledge here on Kickstarter). Which means you will NOT be paying any import/customs duty, sales tax, VAT, etc. We've got everything covered.
*INTERNATIONAL SHIPPING - Rest of the World:
Backers from all other countries (Rest of the world) may have to pay additional import duties and other applicable taxes to the concerned authorities upon receipt of their goods, based on the import policies of their respective countries. The duties and tax rates vary from country to country and we are unable to help you determine that for your shipment. If you wish to learn about the duties and taxes applicable to your shipment, you may want to check with the customs and border protection authority of your country.
From our experience, we have learned that most of the countries have higher thresholds for import duties and a majority of our international customers don't get charged any additional fees apart from the regular shipping fees on Kickstarter.
EXCHANGE POLICY:
If you follow the sizing chart carefully, then the jackets shall fit you just fine. Still, if you wish to exchange your jackets for any reason, we’ll happily do that but you’ll have to pay for the two way shipping. Because we are offering our jackets at highly discounted prices, we won’t be able to accept returns. Please make sure the items are unworn and unwashed. Also, all items must be in the condition you received them with all hangtags still attached. We accept exchanges up to 30 days of you receiving the jacket(s).
LEAD MARKETING PARTNER:
This project is promoted by Jellop, a direct­ response online advertising agency specializing in Kickstarter campaigns on Facebook Ads and Google AdWords.

Our team is comprised of seasoned entrepreneurs, fashion designers, user experience designers, and supply chain experts with more than 40 years of entrepreneurial and manufacturing experience, so rest assured the jackets will exceed your expectations.

campaign.story:
PRAISE “Bob"! – the fates have brought you into an encounter with J.R. “Bob” Dobbs through this instructional video barrage Kickstarter delivery device – the first step on your personal road to SLACK, an unsurpassable beatific experience.
AN IMPORTANT MESSAGE FROM FILMMAKER ALEX COX
PLAY

Alex Cox has directed such cult classics as Repo Man and Sid & Nancy.
DID YOU US IN TEXAS MONTHLY ?!
PREVIOUSLY FORBIDDEN KNOWLEDGE ABOUT THIS FILM 
The Church of the SubGenius has been called “the most aggressively preposterous theology the world has ever known!” But what is the Church? And who is J.R. "Bob" Dobbs? And why is his name always in quotes? And for nonbelievers, why has this strangely compelling parody religion, this long-running postmodern joke, caught the attention of such pop culture icons as Rachel Maddow, Nick Offerman, Jon Stewart, David Letterman, Pee-wee Herman (Paul Reubens), David Byrne, Robert Crumb, Richard Linklater, Alex Cox, Ken Kesey, Frank Zappa, Jonathan Demme, and Devo’s Mark Mothersbaugh? And is it true that Tori Amos is also one of "Bob"’s chosen?  
"Bob" and the Church have caught the attention of many– include David Byrne, Pee-wee Herman (Paul Reubens), Tori Amos, Stephen Colbert, Robert Crumb, Mark Mothersbaugh and DEVO, Matt Groening, Margaret Moser, Rachel Maddow, Nick Offerman, and more.
ARE WE CONTROLLED BY SECRET FORCES? ARE ALIEN MONSTERS BRINGING A STARTLING NEW WORLD? DO PEOPLE THINK YOU’RE STRANGE? DO YOU? 
The Church of the SubGenius: The Early Years
“We tied together every occult, superstitious fringe belief you could think of…it was so much fun!”
– Ivan Stang, co-founder
Born into the suburban world of the 1950s, future founders of the Church of the SubGenius Reverend Ivan Stang (Douglass St. Clair Smith) and Dr. Philo Drummond (Steve Wilcox) come of age during the 1960s and 70s – a time of unprecedented social and political tumult. They experience the rise of a deafening consumer culture, the tarnishing of the "American Dream," the violence of the Vietnam War abroad, and the Kennedy assassinations and conspiracies that follow. 
As youths they revel in the delights of stable families, monster movies, Science Fiction, super-8 moviemaking, dinosaur figures, comic books, and Rock 'n' Roll. As they grow older they witness the emergence of televangelism, the Jonestown Massacre, punk culture, and Reaganomics.
Despite both growing up in Texas, it was not until the mid 70s that Stang and Drummond meet and quickly forge a friendship over a shared love of comic books, Captain Beefheart, and UFO paperbacks. One not so particular eve in 1977, while bemoaning their lack of conventional “success” for two such intelligent, well read chaps, Stang remarks, “Well, we’re not exactly geniuses.” To which Drummond replies, “yeah, we’re sub-geniuses.” 
And in that moment the Church of the SubGenius is born. It is not long after that J.R. "Bob" Dobbs reveals himself as the Church's iconic prophet and foremost patron of ineffable Slack. In fact, Stang and Drummond will later come to the realization that "Bob" has been planting evidence of his presence for them for the past twenty years!!!
THE SUBGENIUS DIASPORA
“There was that moment of realizing that this thing goes further than I ever imagined.”
– Puzzling Evidence (Doug Wellman)
In late 1979 Stang and Drummond, with the help of their wives, brainstorm what would become perhaps the single most significant marketing effort made at the inception of the Church of the SubGenius – the writing, design, printing, and distribution of Pamphlet #1. The doctrine of the Church quickly spreads, and the word of “Bob” and the teachings of JHVH-1 teach “time control” as a way to wrest “Slack” from the ‘Pinks’ and ‘Normals.’ The Church, it seems, has struck a nerve amidst the deadening consumer culture, the evisceration of basic social services, and the worship of wealth that occurred during the Reagan/Thatcher years.
L: An early years Devival | R: The Three Wise Guys – Ivan Stang, Dr.X and Philo Drummond – pose with a Model X Humanoid (1979)
As “Bob”’s pamphlet continues to travel the world, the emergent punk publishing scene and new wave comic writers seize on the humor and cultural critique of the Church's doctrine. In San Francisco it is fished out of a trashcan by cartoonist and artist Paul Mavrides, igniting a SubGenius cell that gives the movement some of its most enduring art and performances through LIES (Paul Mavrides), Dr. Howland Owl (Hal Robins), Puzzling Evidence (Doug Wellman), Janor Hypercleats and Pope Sternodox. 
"Bob" captures the zetigeist of the day. Cartoonist Robert Crumb reprints Pamphlet #1 in the first issue of his comic Weirdo. A few years later Simon and Schuster publishes The Book of the SubGenius.  Acclaimed film director and SubGenius Alex Cox channels Church mythology in Repo Man as the glowing, alien-owned Chevy Malibu soars high above Los Angeles with Otto (Emilio Estevez) and Miller (Tracy Walke) inside, their faces shining with Slack as Bud (Harry Dean Stanton) watches from below. 
Dr. Howl and Puzzling Evidence conduct legendary “Devivals,” radio shows (More than an Hour, Less than a Show), and introduce the word of "Bob" to Burning Man. The Stark Fist of Removal newsletter, The Hour of Slack podcast, an MTV special, and countless cassette tapes, posters, comics, videos, websites, and Facebook groups perpetuate the word of "Bob." 
By the turn of the century, publications as powerful as TIME Magazine begin to get the SubGenius joke when “Bob” is voted ‘Fraud of the Century” by readers of its online poll. In the late 90’s and early 2000’s, the “Free Party” constituents of Brighton in Great Britain voted “Bob” Dobbs as an M.P. to the House of Commons three times.
Today, “Bob”’s hucksterism and the wisdom of JHVH-1 is apparent in all fifty states and a multitude of countries across the globe!
PLAY

Another early SubGenius of Texas, David Boone (late husband of Slacking Towards Bethlehem director Sandy K. Boone), documents the rise of the SubGenius in his 1980 film, Invasion of the Aluminum People, which is lauded by Academy Award winning director Jonathan Demme. This is one of the first known recorded instances of the transmission of SLACK.
GIVE TO THIS KICKSTARTER NOW AND ACHIEVE SALVATION – OR TRIPLE YOUR MONEY BACK!!!!!!
Only with your support can our intrepid group of award-winning filmmakers dare to make this film. By giving us your hard earned cash, we can make this dream a reality, and breach all Earthly human, political, and cultural barriers with the searing nonhuman truth of the Word of "Bob," J.R. "Bob" Dobbs, that LIVING GOD WHO WALKS THIS PLANET EARTH IN HUCKSTER'S SHOES. 
To date, we’ve travelled over 8,000 miles and interviewed 15 SubGenius in four cities, sharing the so-called "reality" that SubGenii are forced to share with humans. We’ve only just begun to uncover many of the SubGenius’ most guarded secrets. The SubGenii are finally willing to go public and tell the TRUTH. 
This is YOUR chance to get in on the ground floor of a huge, globally important cult. You will then attract all the $$$, pleasure spacecraft, and SHEER POWER OVER OTHERS that go with high-ranking support of the Church and this documentary! 
But most important, you can smite your enemies, achieve TIME CONTROL and attain SLACK.
REMEMBERING SAINT MARGARET
Since we began production on our film, a beloved avatar of the early SubGenius tribe, Margaret Moser, passed away on August 25 of this year. One of the nation’s top music journalists and music scene nurturers, Reverend Reverend Doctor Doctor Archdoctor Saint Margaret Moser even had a photo of J.R. “Bob” Dobbs on her Austin Chronicle business card. She said it helped her connect with her interview subjects, many of whom were already members of the Church themselves.
PLAY

In her interview with us, she spoke about the pleasure, “the great release, to have all this nutty stuff in your head and find like minded people to express it with.” But most notably she sang a song written by her own hand, "Oh, Life's a Bowl of Cherries with "Bob" Dobbs." Saint Moser's life epitomized the way that membership in the Church accelerated the discovery of true friendships, experimentations, creative collisions, and rebellion through art, music, and comedy against dehumanization in any form.
WHY THIS FILM? 
Why not this film? Pull the wool over your own eyes and help us make a movie! The Church of the SubGenius is the underground movement that has galvanized the imaginative, the artistic, the nerdy, even the deranged – to examine the simmering dystopia in their culture, and do absolutely nothing about it... except, maybe, poke fun at it all. The Church of the SubGenius is taking over the universe. The sooner you learn about it, the better off you’ll be. 
PLAY

Now more than ever we feel that the story of the Church of the SubGenius needs to be told. There's a core of ideas within the SubGenius ethos – of fighting oppression with humor, community and creativity, of using absurdity as a nonviolent weapon, giving time, permission and priority to expression, creation, and zaniness with friends –  that we think has great value we believe these ideas are necessary in today's world and that our film about the SubGenius is the perfect way to invoke them.
Amongst all the spaceships, frop, pipes, eye-bludgeoning graphics, bulldada, yeti ancestors, (and yes, ‘macho spoutings’), we hope you will fund this film so you can join our merry band of pranksters on the culture-jam of the century! It’s going to be a lot of fun!!!
No stranger to hiding in plain sight – "Bob" is everywhere, IF you know to look for him!
So please, give to our film, get our cool merch, show up at screenings, and talk to us in every way possible. We will have our third nostril open at all times.
And remember, as one famous SubGenius said, “since the main message is ‘think for yourself,’ the last thing you should be doing is believing all we’re telling you. We make it up as we go along.”
Ivan Stang hosts the 999 Club (1981)
WHAT WILL THE FUNDS BE USED FOR?
With this funding, we can complete the remaining interviews, edit the film, animate key sequences, and all other post-production work necessary to bring this ridiculous story to the masses.
A behind the scenes look at our film production. Note that "Bob" is never too far from where we are. (L: Image courtesy of Paul Mavrides | R: Image courtesy of Kelly Cash)
HOW YOU CAN HELP
A Boy's Guide - fig. 13013
Let ‘Bob’ into your savings. 
Kickstarter is ALL-OR-NOTHING – If we don’t meet our $199,999.99 goal, we won’t receive ANY of the funding. Don't let The Conspiracy win!  We need to get this story out into the world before it all comes to an end.
Tomorrow is obsolete. 
SHUT UP PINK BOY AND PLEDGE EARLY! – Be the ultimate slacker and slack off on slacking. The earlier you pledge, the more likely others are to contribute.
Instant answers to everything!
Don’t wallow in submission. Reveal the Church of the SubGenius Documentary to your slackless friends through social media, and watch as their Pink minds become wonderful, abnormal soups of mush. Just how we like it.
Blasted by knowledge
SHUT UP OR STAND UP BY SHARING OUR FILM ON SOCIAL MEDIA!  – How can you direct your friends to our Kickstarter? Write your own post linking our Kickstarter at bit.ly/SlackOn, or, for the slack-est among you use one of our pre-written posts below –
Twitter: Praise "Bob"! I have the SLACK it takes to give all my money to this new film. Do YOU? Don't wallow in submission any longer! bit.ly/SlackOn
Facebook: Praise "Bob"! I have the SLACK it takes to give all my money to this new film. Do YOU? The Church of the SubGenius is the subject of a new documentary I am supporting – check it out! But beware, you might pull the wool over your own eyes in the process. bit.ly/SlackOn
THE REWARDS
To THANK YOU for backing our documentary we have a great selection of classic favorites -- and more. But this campaign also offers some extremely unique items. So dive in. Look around. Scroll your way to bliss!
Partnering with Paul Mavrides, we will have an original film poster by one of the great artists and cartoonists living today. NO KIDDING! This is going to be something you don’t want to miss. And we also already received --- shhhhhhh! – some amazing, crazy, stuff – memorabilia, illustrations, artwork -- from the archives of some celebrity and anonymous SubGenius alike. Stay tuned. This is the stuff that will never, ever make its way to Ebay.
*Final Reward designs may vary.

Items marked as “limited” are truly one of a kind items created specifically for this campaign as a unique offering to thank you for becoming part of the team. From a “Bob” toaster that will help you begin your day with edible Slack to real life film credits in our finished film, we hope you embrace “Bob”’s rule of thumb that “too much is always better than not enough.
Claim 'em quick! Limited quantities available.
PAUL MAVRIDES ORIGINAL ART
We know what you're thinking. FINE ARTS? SUBGENIUS? How much frop are you smoking? Paul Mavrides is one of the originators and sustainers of the SubGenius aesthetic, and he is also a major artist whose work shows at Fine Art galleries and whose graphic design is sought after by companies like Apple. Writing about Paul for a recent show at the Steven Wolfe Fine Arts Gallery in San Francisco, art critic Mark Van Proyers said that SubGenius output is a key influence "on much of the art production of the 1990s... and the mythomaniacal clip-art orgies that Mavrides concocted for several of the highly entertaining “SubGenious” books still seem to sustain a spot-on freshness…."
NEW REWARDS GENEROUSLY DONATED BY LOUIS BLACK, FROM HIS PERSONAL COLLECTION
Louis Black is the co-founder of the Austin Chronicle and co-founder of the South By Southwest Music Festival and Conference (SXSW).
ANNOUNCING NEW REWARDS FROM COMIC BOOK ARTIST CULLY HAMNER. AND WE'RE KINDA GEEKING OUT OVER IT!
Cully Hamner is an American comic book artist, known for his work on such books as Green Lantern: Mosaic, Blue Beetle, Black Lightning: Year One, and Detective Comics.
MORE COOL CRAP FROM SubGenius DR. PHILO DRUMMOND! Signed by KRK RYDEN
KRK Ryden is an artist, musician, SubGenii and Bay Area native. His surrealistic art style is reflective of his taste in cartoons and pulp art and his work is described as "colorful and visually appealing reflections on discarded icons."
ABOUT THE FILMMAKERS 
SANDY K BOONE | Director / Producer
Sandy K. Boone began making films in Austin in the 1980s with her late husband, filmmaker David Boone, whose Texas cult classic Invasion of the Aluminum People was presented by director Jonathan Demme at the Collective for Living Cinema in 1981 in New York. Three decades later, Boone and Black produced a restoration of the film as part of Jonathan Demme: Made in Texas – Six Films From Austin, which premiered at SXSW in 2015. At that screening, Richard Linklater told how seeing Invasion, and another of the MIT films at an art gallery screening in Houston inspired him to move to Austin.
LOUIS BLACK | Executive Producer 
Louis Black co-founded The Austin Chronicle, where he was editor for more than three decades, SXSW, where he is a director, and was a founding Board Member of the Austin Film Society. He has written extensively on film, music and politics. Executive producer of Be Here to Love Me, A Film About Townes Van Zandt, he was a producer on the Peabody Award Winning The Order of Myths. Working with Mark Rance he produced a reissue of Eagle Pennell's The Whole Shootin' Match.
Sandy K Boone and Louis Black, of Black and Boone Productions.
BLACK AND BOONE now closely collaborate on all projects. They were deeply involved in crafting, structuring and shaping the documentary Richard Linklater – dream is destiny, which premiered at the 2016 Sundance Film Festival and was the initial screening of PBS's American Masters 2017 Fall season. They worked as Executive Producers on Keith Maitland's critically acclaimed Tower and Karen Skloss' The Honor Farm, which premiered at SXSW. They are executive producers on The Newspaperman and Road Angel, both still in production. Blaze, written and directed by Ethan Hawke, on which they worked, is scheduled for a 2018 release. Their next project to be released is Eggshells, a reissue of Tobe Hooper’s first film from 1969.
MICHELLE RANDOLPH FAIRES | Producer
Michelle Randolph Faires began her career in independent film by supporting area film-related non-profit organizations before moving into production. She worked with Austin Film Festival as the Festival & Conference Hospitality Coordinator for two years before joining the staff full-time as the Outreach and Community Coordinator. Additionally, she supported aGLIFF, as the Volunteer Coordinator and Festival Manager, later serving a full three year term on the Board of Directors. After moving into the production world, she produced her first short, followed by a feature length documentary on the legendary Broken Spoke dancehall, Honky Tonk Heaven. The film premiered at SXSW 2016 and earned an Audience Award. Michelle has been a part of the funding and producing teams for film projects The Newspaperman, Leslie and Monkey Business: The Adventures of Curious George's Creators, as well as PBS-KLRU series Standup Empire, a series showcasing the expansive comedy scene in Austin, Texas.
LAUREN SANDERS | Editor 
Lauren Sanders is an editor and post-production supervisor with experience on a wide range of commercial and film projects. After working as senior editor at Arts+Labor for 6 years, she collaborated extensively with clients like GSD&M and C3. Her most recent film credits include post-supervisor on 2017's comedy, Ripped, co-writer and editor on the documentary The Jones Family Will Make a Way, and assistant editor and co-composer on Clay Liford's Slash. She also is credited as post-production supervisor and assistant editor on Kat Candler’s Hellion, an official selection of both the Sundance and SXSW film festivals. Lauren is a graduate of the Radio-Television-Film program at the University of Texas at Austin.
DAVID LAYTON | Director of Photography
David Layton is an Austin-based filmmaker with a passion for cinematography and documentary film. He began his career as a newspaper reporter, but honed his technical skills working in the camera department on notable documentary features such as The Unforeseen, Be Here to Love Me, The Devil and Daniel Johnston, You’re Gonna Miss Me, Nuclear Family, Troop 1500, and Letter From Waco. He was cinematographer on two recent PBS documentaries, By the River of Babylon: An Elegy for South Louisiana and Through the Repellant Fence: A Land Art Film. Most recently, David shot the feature documentary Richard Linklater – dream is destiny and is directing/producing The Newspaperman about legendary Philadelphia Inquirer editor Gene Roberts.
IVAN STANG | Consultant
Ivan Stang is a writer, filmmaker, radio broadcaster/personality, as well as one of the founders of the Church of the SubGenius. As a filmmaker, Stang has done animation work and editing for films such as Arise!: The SubGenius Video, a “spoof” documentary for the Church of the SubGenius, and animation work for MTV and music video shorts. He is most notable for writing The Book of the SubGenius, and other SubGenius literature. Stang hosts the hour-long radio broadcast "The Hour of Slack," produced partially by WCSB at Cleveland State University and syndicated across North America. He remains an active SubGenii, continuing his work with the Church and appearing at X-Day, the SubGenius celebration held every year in Ohio, where Stang resides.
A POEM WRITTEN BY THE FILMMAKERS

project_data.project_name: The Church of the SubGenius | A Documentary

campaign.story:
UPDATE - The Project is Being Relaunched. 
Please Check the updates section for more information. Thank you!
What's The Story?
Happy Happy Joy Joy, The Ren & Stimpy Story will shed light on how a cartoon about a twisted chihuahua and a dim-witted cat became an animation masterpiece; influenced American television, comedy and 90's pop culture at large; rebelled against the status quo and affected the lives of those involved. The 90 minute film will feature interviews with key players and fans, never before seen footage of the show’s development, archival footage and original animation.
Where Are We Now?
Over the past year, Kimo and I have shot dozens of interviews with artists, writers, directors, producers, and executives who contributed to Ren & Stimpy. We've also traveled back and forth across the US and Canada, interviewing fans and major celebrities who fell in love with the series.
The footage has been captured in full 4k...and it's stunning. Many of those connected to the show have also opened up their personal archives, allowing us to photograph never before seen Ren & Stimpy storyboards, concept art, pencil tests and stills. 
Why Kickstarter?
The next phase is post production. It's expensive and that's why we are asking for your help. Here are the top line costs we need to cover to complete the project:
Music and Music Licensing - Oscar-nominated Composer Shawn Patterson, who worked on Ren & Stimpy, is helping us out but we still need to license some of the show's music, pay the musicians and book the studio.
Original Animation - One of the key components of the film will be original, animated shorts based on stories told to us by Ren & Stimpy alumni. The animation will be in the same hand-drawn style of Ren & Stimpy -- and it's a TON of work. We are hiring some of the uber-taleneted artists that have worked with John K to create these. 
Main Titles & Interstitials - We have some killer ideas on how to visually present the archival materials. Simon Clowes, who is the motion graphics genius behind the title sequences for Superman Returns, Sherlock Holmes, and Xmen: First Class is onboard. He's helping us out but we still need to pay his team.
 Sound Design / Editing / Mixing - Brian Mendelsohn, another R&S alumnus, will be doing the sound. We need to buy drives, license FX, cover studio costs and compensate Brian for some of his time.
 Legal & Licensing - Not the most exciting part of the process but really necessary given all the footage and artwork we'd like to include. Help.
The Rewards - Yup, all those great looking items are high quality and cost dough....some of which is going directly to the original R & S artists.
We have HOURS of fantastic interviews, TONS of amazing archival artwork, an AMAZING TEAM in place, and now we just need YOU! 
Please take a look at the list of rewards and choose one (or a few if you can!) Kimo and I would really appreciate it and you will too when you see the film.
Choosing Multiple Rewards
Here's how to choose more than one reward: 
1- You need to make the initial pledge. You'll see a "Back this Project" button if you haven't pledge yet
2- After your pledge, Press the "Manage your pledge Button above."
3 - Increase your pledge in the "pledge amount" box by the total monetary amount of the add ons you want to add.
4 - After the end of the campaign, you'll receive a survey asking, "How would you like to use the additional funds?"
Questions?
We'd love to hear from you! Contact us here on Kickstarter, on our Facebook page at Facebook.com/renandstimpydoc or by email at renandstimpydoc@gmail.com.  
If we exceed our goal, we will be adding stretch rewards so please check back before the campaign ends. We will send out updates to keep you posted.
Please note, the exact release date of the film is still in flux and will affect when DVD's and links are sent out. Rest assured, we want to see the completed film as much as you do!
Other Ways to Help
We are hugely grateful for any monetary contributions you can make to the film. We would also appreciate your effort in spreading the word about the project on social media, email or even old school one on one's. Thanks again!
A Note on John K & Nickelodeon
Happy Happy Joy Joy, The Ren & Stimpy Story is being independently financed. John Kricfalusi is not backing the film, nor is Nickelodeon -- it's only Kimo and I.   "Ren & Stimpy" and any relevant characters are fully copyrighted and owned by Viacom / Nickelodeon and are used with permission.
We have asked John K multiple times for an interview. He has okay'd the participation of several people close to him, however, as of now, John himself has refused to participate...but who knows what the future holds.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We are incredibly fortunate to have the support of so many of the original Ren & Stimpy crew. We have also have received an initial project sign-off by Nickelodeon, who owns the licensing rights to Ren & Stimpy. This occurred days before launching this campaign and we could not be more excited! Needless to say, this has mitigated a lot of our risk. 

The only other challenge would be finishing the film with a reduced budget. That said, Kimo and I are both very confident, given our years in film and TV, and the support of so many Ren & Stimpy fans, we'll be able to meet that challenge and complete the film this year.
