campaign.story:
Isolated Mutations of the Assembly Line Baby: What is it? 
Hi there, I'm Jon Schnepp, and I've been working in the field of entertainment and mass media for more than 25 years. I went to the School of the Art Institute of Chicago (SAIC), and was forever transformed by my experiences there, and in the years that followed, performing with my friends and fellow artists, writing experimental poetry and music, and painting, writing, and drawing constantly. These early 90's experiences that were fueled by electric coffee and late night boozing, intense conversations about the future, the present, the past. Going to SAIC art school and being into performance art, metal shows, poetry readings, and last call pool halls. This is the mental goo from where Neo-Geneticism™ was born: 
"Isolated Mutations of the Assembly Line Baby" is a book I've been working on and off on for over 25 years. I've finally finished it, and am currently creating the original art for the beginning of each chapter in the book, 28 pieces in all. I first started writing the words of Neo-Geneticism™ through the voice of Tefflon Frampps®, and then the voices of both his followers and detractors came rushing forward in the form of many more additional chapters, words within words, books within books, thoughts within thoughts. This ebbed and flowed in the early 90's, then more in 2003-2005, and then picked up again in the 2013, to final book completion this month of May 2017. In pledging your support to help me make this book and get it out to the general public, you will not only be helping in spreading the word of Neo-Geneticism™, but you will also be helping in the shared completion of a more than 25 year artistic process for myself. 
What I Need & What You Get 
Let me create several more containers of truth: This money is to help me print and distribute the art book "Isolated Mutations of the Assembly Line Baby". Any money made over that will go towards making additional video pieces of art for this project's next phase. You will get the "Isolated Mutations of the Assembly Line Baby" Hardcover book, along with options to get limited Printed Editions. The "Impact" This is an art book, and the chapters are free-flowing yet ultimately connected by both it's harsh group leader, Tefflon Frampps®, and his belief in how Neo-Geneticism™ can truly transform the living mind, and bend it proper:
 "Isolated Mutations of the Assembly Line Baby" is an art book that I look forward to releasing onto the readers of the world. I have had great success with crowd-funding two projects, the animated pilot "Grimm Fairy Tales", and the live action documentary "The Death of Superman Lives: What Happened?". These were both successfully crowd-sourced and funded at the Kickstarter site. This book can only exist with your help in making it happen. 
Other Ways You Can Help 
If you can’t contribute monetarily, here's other ways you can help: Please share this campaign, help get the word out on Twitter, Facebook, Instagram, and all your other social media platforms. Help spread the words of Tefflon Frampps® and the Neo-Geneticists™, and have fun with it as well. Use the Kickstarter tools that are provided, for ease of mass communication with your friends!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This book represents a several decades long project, one that I've noodled on since 1991 when I lived in Chicago, and used to do lots of spoken word poetry and live performances, doing reading and rants in front of local bands at various bars across the city.

I've decided to make getting this book out of my hands and into yours as easy as possible! Not only providing a digital version, but a Paperback as well. Making the deliverables very clean and simple make it so I can concentrate on getting the books out immediately upon receiving them from the printers.

I've run a few successful kickstarters, and the thing that always gummed it up for me was all the extra dindads and thingamajogs promised for an additional few bucks. I've shipped out all the blurays and dvds, but it's that darn patch or poster that makes it take much much longer. I still need to ship a few of the bigger and harder to make rewards, and as I get those finished, I don't want that problem moving forward. Henceforth, a very simple, clean and easy rewards system that can be completed and shipped, and are all part of the actual book I'm creating for you to enjoy.

This kickstarter is just going to be about the books, with a small group of options and added bonus items to make it fun and doable. I hope to move this project onward to its next phase, later in the year, by making accompanying videos.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Prepping the printing of the books!!!
updates.update_content:
Backers,
Printing is being setup next week to begin the second week of July, so I'll be getting the books in by end of July, and shipped out to you by the first week of August!!! 
I'm going to be sending out the cover for the book in two weeks, and you'll be the first to see it! I'm putting the finishing touches on the chapters, and getting the art finalized as well.

Backers,
Here we are, edging towards the end of March. I'm closing in on getting this book in your hands! 
I was hoping to have a shorter "ashcan" preview printing available for WonderCon, which is this coming weekend, but real life got in the way, and I have no reason to "rush" this book until it is complete and finished exactly the way I want it to be. 
With that, my final goal is to have it printed up and ready to ship to you in the next few months, so as close to the launch date from a year ago as I can get it, which was May 16th, the better!

Kickstarters, 
Thank you all for supporting and sharing this project with so many other artists. This is a very personal project for me, and I really thank each and every one of you that helped in any way to bring this book to physical reality.

campaign.story:
Jollylook - A simple fold out camera for analog snapshots, made entirely from recycled paper and cardboard. No electronics - some paper, a pair of lenses and a cartridge for instant mini photos. Environment friendly - we use less materials than used in the packaging of a regular camera. The camera body, the shutter and aperture are made of thick paper and laminated cardboard.
Stretch Goals:
Vintage Design - retro with a little steampunk.
Foldout and Compact - a little bigger than an iphone box.
A Great Gift - can be used immediately and instantly.
A Great Toy - Jollylook is a great teaching toy for children. Your kid can take it apart and see how it works.
A Great Souvenir - even after use Jollylook is beautiful on the shelf!
Fun - entertaining and positive emotions.
Beautiful Photos - using Instax mini film you get 10 instant classic color or monochrome analog unique photos. (the cartridges can be changed many times easily and quickly )
Environment Friendly - easily recyclable, as dangerous to the environment as a banana peal!
The Magic
When moments of life that we see freeze on paper - it is magic. Imagine the people who saw it happen for the first time nearly two hundred years ago! Year after year, many people learned "freezing" moments of life on paper. Take what we made for you and create the magic for yourself, learn and experience some part of what had to be done, all the effort to freeze a moment.
The Magic!
How does it work?
Just as an analog plastic and metal camera! Set the lens position to landscape, group, portrait or macro:
Choose the aperture  (f/8, f/11, f/16, f/22; f/32; f/45; f/64; pinhole)
Pull out the viewfinder:
 Look through the viewfinder:
Press the shutter-release button!
  Then roll out the exposed photo by turning the handle for developing - the rollers break the capsule with the processing liquid, and initiate the developing process.
After a few minutes you have a unique photo in your hands
 Jollylook uses Fujifilm “instax mini” instant film cartridges which are available worldwide
  The cartridges can be changed many times!
How it all began:
Once I was showing my son what's inside the analog camera and how analog photography works, I thought then - "what if the package itself transformed and fulfilled the function of the camera and the picture turned out immediately?! There was no problem with instant photo technology, people solved this problem long time ago. What remained to create was an analog camera that would be simple and contained in the package, worked properly and allowed to take photos and get instant results.
I had to study the structure of many analog cameras, before being able to make the shutter - the most difficult part in the development was the shutter (no existing structure worked for Jollylook, so I had to invent a new shutter). After construction and testing of many prototypes we made it, a shutter which works perfectly and consists of only four pieces of thick paper and two tiny circular rubber bands. After picking the right lens and calculating the aperture, we created a folding "accordion" camera body from paper, then the case where the cartridge is placed, and we moved to the design, here there where no doubts - it had to be retro with a little steampunk look. Then we had difficulties with the unit for getting the photo out from the cartridge but after testing many options, we achieved a perfect result, photographs are now developed and pulled with a rotating handle.
And of course, drawings and mockups ...and then the development of the production technology, the development of the equipment necessary for manufacturing, the selection of materials, the search and selection of contractors, and many other important little things that make up the production preparation.
Some photos taken with Jollylook:
    You can take close-ups from a distance of 50 cm (20 in) and you can take photos with a pinhole.
  A pinhole is a tiny hole that acts as a lens, you only need accuracy and patience. When taking photos with the pinhole - exposition can be up to a few minutes long!
You can take photos with a manually operated shutter speed and you can take double exposed photos
P.S. The photo with the dog is the first ever photo made with Jollylook!
Jollylook consists of:
Technical specifications:
Lens - a meniscus lens with a focal length of 110 mm ( 4.33 in ), allows to take photos from portrait to landscape. can be moved up to shoot through the pinhole.
Viewfinder - a Fresnel lens 
Aperture - a switchable diaphragm with manual adjustment for the seven values: f / 8, f / 11, f / 16, f / 22; f / 32; f / 45; f / 64 + pinhole.
Shutter - automatic with shutter speed of 1/250 or 1/160 and manual shutter mode with the possibility to control the exposure time manually.
Pinhole - a round hole in a copper foil 0.6 mm (0.023 in) in diameter, located on the diaphragm disk
10 shots per instax mini cartridge (the cartridge can be changed many times)
Storage conditions - store in a dry and dark place at room temperature.
conditions of use - use at temperatures between 10 - 35 °C (50 -95 ℉) in dry weather.
Size when folded 85 x 127 x 48 mm ( 311⁄32 x 5 x 157⁄64 in )
Fujifilm “instax mini” instant film cartridge
Photo size 46(W) x 62(H) mm
The Rewards:
 The Jollylook Team:
Oleg Khalip - the author of the idea - a designer and inventor with 30 years of experience in organization and design of production facilities in the field of engineering.
Yuri Sibiryakov - an experienced designer with 40 years of experience in aviation engineering, design of devices and equipment. in Jollylook he is in charge of product design and production equipment.
Evgeniy Ivanov – a film director who loves instant photography and film. Our internet man, takes care of marketing, PR and social networks.
Anna Gorbenko - organizes cooperations and procurement, monitors the delivery and saves our money. Also many times she reminds us to eat!
Mariia Khalip – creates computer graphics and artwork. Inspires us with her neatness and greate sense of style.
What is done:
Developed, manufactured and tested several dozens of prototypes
We have developed various versions and tested the tooling for production
We applied for a patent in the US and globally
What has to be done:
Order the production of molds for the lenses and the developing unit
Organize a large-scale production
Marketing
Why do we need you support?
We chose Kickstarter because this is where people who are interested in everything new and unusual are, they are positive and supportive. We can make sure Jollylook has fans all over the world. We will be able to pay for the manufacture of molds for the lenses and the developing device and to organize large-scale production.

We studied delivery methods and shipping costs within the US and abroad.

campaign.story:
Stop Motion Animation as an Art Form
 Since the beginning of filmmaking stop motion animation has been the go to for the artistic expression of classic films. Its charm and wonder is in everything from commercials, television shows, and feature films, to the classic visual effects that are beloved by so many. In todays society of high tech computer graphic engineering it's important to keep perspective of both modern and classic techniques along with recognizing that those classical artistic techniques are not out of date and are yet still very much relevant.
What is Stop Motion Magazine 
Stop Motion Magazine is one of the very rare publications in the world that focuses on an art form that can use every artistic method known to man. This little publication which has been published since 2009 takes its readers deep behind the scenes where they can get an up close and personal look at films and production both big and small. Stop Motion Magazine is a valuable resource to artists all over the world as a source of reference for their own productions, as an educational supplement, and as a source of news for what is going on in the industry. The magazine is produced as a quarterly publication that is available in both print and digital versions. We also produce stopmotionmagazine.net which is the magazines website with up to date information, news, and entertainment. 
Fundraising for 2017
 We are running our Stop Motion Magazine 2017 KickStarter campaign to keep the lights on and the wheels turning while we continue production of the magazine. With your support we will be able to publish the magazine in 2017 and provide you with one of the most comprehensive animation publications in the world. The artists that have been featured in Stop Motion Magazine are a very diverse group of people from all over the world. Some of them are world famous and some of them are just artists wanting to share their favorite medium with the world. Unlike larger publications this little magazine doesn't have the luxury of accepting print subscribers year round. To be able to determine our publishing needs and budget for the year we need to run these type of campaign drives to insure that the magazine stays alive. Kind of like how Public Television runs a campaign to keep their lights on. Your contribution no matter how big or small will insure that we are able to stay in print for the 2017 calendar year. So please contribute if you can.

campaign.story:
Duh-Doodles started as a convention game called "I'd Done Drawn That!" we wrote down random geeky characters and objects on pieces of paper which people would pull out of a container at random. 
From expert drawers to stick figure creations, people loved playing the game because it was geared to fandoms they loved.
We decided to rebrand the game and figure out a game play system that would make everything random, with multiple possible combinations. So we came up with the 3 card deck system. 
The first deck, the Chumies (Or Chimi-Chums as our fans are called) give us a person, place, or thing. The second deck, The Verbulator, is our action card (kicking, licking, riding, eating, etc.) That leaves us with our last deck, the wild card. This is a random object/person, to toss a little bit more weirdness to the mix!
The Duh-Doodler will draw one card from each deck. They can place them in any order they like. They have one minute to draw what they drew from the deck. After the minute they must show the person/group, which then have a minute to guess what it is. The Duh-Doodler is not allowed to give them hints, but they can signal them if the person/group guesses one of the cards right. It's just that simple. 
We are asking for start-up money to bring our prototype to life. This money will be used to make professional decks, boxes, and help pay for the rewards and delivery of the completed game.

campaign.story:
****UPDATE 9/28****
NEW REWARD - Signed Cast Photo - $80
NEW REWARD - Extra Special Thanks - $250
NEW REWARD - Associate Producer - $500
Make sure to check out our THREE NEW REWARDS! If you've already pledged, you can upgrade to claim these awesome new perks.
  A mad scientist, a monster, and a telepathic severed head. What more could you ask for?
The Brain That Wouldn't Die is a satirical remake of the 1962 public domain B-­movie of the same name. Both follow the misadventures of Dr. Bill Cortner, a brilliant but unorthodox surgeon, who revives the head of his recently decapitated fiancee, Jan Compton, in hopes that he can find her a new body.
Knowing full well that he will have to murder an innocent woman to do so, Bill's intentions are revealed to be less than noble, especially after it becomes clear that he seeks not only a viable body, but a "perfect body" – a quest that takes him through the seedier parts of the city, from smoky cabarets to sleazy swimsuit competitions.
All the while, Jan, determined to bring an end to her suffering, uses her newly acquired psychic abilities (because why not) to communicate with another of Bill's botched experiments. Together, they plot their revenge...
"What I've done, I've done. And what I've done is right." - Bill Cortner
 The remake will be a satirical take on the story, utilizing both the intentional and not-­so-­intentional comedic elements of the original, while bolstering its characters and plot. The script was written by Hank Huffman and the film will be directed by Derek Carl, the team responsible for the short film Bad Seed and the upcoming web series Y2K 2000. We will be starting production in mid­-October and the final version will enter the festival circuit in 2017.
PLAY

A special message from the star of The Brain That Wouldn't Die, Patrick Green.
  Bad Seed was shot on a shoestring budget with a tiny crew. Just think of what we could do with a full professional crew and $70,000!
  The team behind The Brain That Wouldn't Die has been working together for quite a while. It started with the Western short film, Bad Seed, where Derek Carl, Hank Huffman, Molly Preston, Daniel Timothy Treacy, and Jason Reynolds worked together for the first time. The synchronicity between the cast and crew led to one of the most enjoyable film experiences we'd ever had. Since then, we've been committed to keeping this merry band of misfits together, as we move from short films, to pilots, to features.
Derek, Hank, Molly and Jason working on "Bad Seed"
As time went on, our team grew to include many more talented actors and crew members. It is our goal to bring together the best that Portland, OR has to offer, and to showcase the amazing talent that lives here.
On the set of "Y2K 2000"
Portland is a thriving city for independent artists of all stripes, and one of the few alternatives to Los Angeles when it comes to production hubs on the West Coast. And while the city has become noted for its success in television, with hit shows like NBC's Grimm and IFC's Portlandia, we are determined to bring that same recognition to the Portland film scene.
We love working together, and we don't mind getting a little cozy
Our team has been very successful together. We have been recognized by numerous film festivals, and have won multiple film making awards. We have no doubt that we will continue this record of success with The Brain That Wouldn't Die.
        Derek Carl is an accomplished director and producer based out of New York, NY. His strong visual style can be seen in all of his work, including Bad Seed, Slumber Party, Snuff, and Y2K 2000. Derek is the co-founder of the Portland-based Flagship Features, and the founder of the New York-based Coalition Studios.
  Hank Huffman is a Portland-based screenwriter and film producer, and co-founder of Flagship Features. While specializing in comedy, Hank’s scripts run the gamut from monster movies to murder mysteries. His credited works include the Western short film Bad Seed and the upcoming web series Y2K 2000.
  Kevin Forrest is a freelance director, cinematographer and independent filmmaker living in Portland, OR. Kevin is also the co­-owner of the local film collective, Portland Film Works. His ability to create unique and stunning visuals has gained him entry into numerous national film festivals. In addition to his film work, Kevin assists with video production classes at Portland Community College.
  Molly Preston is a filmmaker living in Portland, OR. She works primarily as a producer and an editor, with a range of features, short films, music videos, and commercials under her belt. Her short film Carl, noted for its use of both digital and traditional film, recently won the “Best of Oregon Short Film” award at the 2015 Oregon Independent Film Festival.
  Daniel Timothy Treacy, founder of Hyperbole Productions, is a Portland-based actor, comedian and film producer, known for his work in award winning short films such as Broken, The Stairs, and A Letter to Bob. His producer credits include Bad Seed and Y2K 2000.  
  Tiffany Ayers is a Portland-based filmmaker and production designer, whose art department credits include features (V-Force: New Dawn of V.I.C.T.O.R.Y.), television (Significant Mother), music videos (Aesop Rock's Blood Sandwich), and various commercials.
  "I can promise you one thing: your grandchildren won't be test-tube babies." - Jan Compton
  Rachael Perrell Fosket is a Portland-based actress. She made her big screen debut in How the Fire Fell, and has continued to star in award winning films such as Death on a Rock and Welcoming Departure. You can also see her on television, appearing in hit shows such as Grimm, The Librarians, Portlandia, and The Department Of Time Travel.
  Patrick Green is an actor, performing in film, television, and theater. His stage roles include John Worthing in The Importance of Being Earnest, Thomas Cromwell in A Man for All Seasons, multiple roles in The Most Fabulous Story Ever Told, and Le Vicomte de Valmont in Les Liaisons Dangereuses. Patrick has appeared on television in the NBC series Grimm and in a national Jeep Renegade commercial. In the past year, he has starred in several feature films, including The Texture of Falling and Crazy Right.
  Jason Reynolds is an actor who has starred in numerous films, including Work Hard, The American Dream and Thirst. Jason also stars in the upcoming features Carnivorous Love, and Cold Chains, Hard Hearts and Bloody Hands.
  Born and raised in the Pacific Northwest, Mia Allen began acting for film in high school and hasn’t looked back. Mia starred in the Portland ­themed independent comedy, Zilla and Zoe, as well as the avant garde silent period­ piece, CPR. She was recently awarded “Best Lead Actress in a Short Film” for her performance in No, Oui. Mia splits her performance efforts with the management of a commercial production company, Limbo Films.
  Robert Blanche is a film and television actor, currently residing in Portland, OR. Since 1994, he has appeared in over eighty film and television projects, including Men of Honor, World Trade Center and NBC’s Grimm, where he portrays series regular “Sgt. Franco.” Additional television credits include Leverage, Z Nation, Monk and It’s Always Sunny in Philadelphia.
  It's a family movie.
      Our primary reason for making this movie is because it's precisely the kind of movie we want to see. A fun, edgy, B­-movie inspired romp that emphasizes practical effects. We have a special fondness for films with that charming handmade quality, be it Evil Dead 2 or Re­-Animator – there's no mistaking a gallon of fake blood for CGI.
It also doesn't hurt that this story contains thought provoking social commentary that (sadly) seems just as relevant today as it did in 1962.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Decapitation.

FACT! – Studies show that one in every five Americans will experience some form of decapitation within their lifetime. Should this happen to a member(s) of our cast or crew, it would significantly slow down the production. Fortunately, we have developed a serum that may rectify the situation (mwah ha ha).

Joking aside, there are very real risks involved with independent filmmaking. It is always possible that unforeseen circumstances keep the film from being finished on schedule. But as the great Bruce Campbell once said, “If a movie has a release date, it's not a true indie.” Making films outside of the studio system is a risky venture but when it succeeds, it can change the course of mainstream cinema (see Evil Dead, Clerks, Sex Lies and Videotape).

Finally, as with all remakes, we run the risk of upsetting fans of the original. That said, it's not like we're remaking a hallmark of American cinema (*cough* Psycho *cough*). We are confident that our film will be readily embraced by fans of the original and newcomers alike. We remake it as to honor its legacy.

For more information about this project, go to: http://www.brainthatwouldntdiemovie.com
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

UPDATE: Each Voyager Golden Record: 40th Anniversary Edition vinyl box set (pledges of $98 or more) now includes the high-quality enamel pin of the Golden Record diagram and a custom turntable slipmat featuring NASA/JPL-Caltech's heliocentric view of the Voyager spacecrafts' trajectories across the solar system! Thank you so much for your support!
The Voyager Golden Record was a gift from humanity to the cosmos. And it is also a gift to humanity.
In 1977, NASA launched two spacecraft, Voyager I and II, on a grand tour of the solar system and beyond, into the mysteries of interstellar space. Mounted to each of these spacecraft is a stunning golden phonograph record, an interstellar message to introduce our civilization to extraterrestrials who might encounter the probes, perhaps billions of years from now. 
The Voyager Golden Record contains the story of Earth expressed in sounds, images, and science: Earth's greatest music from myriad cultures and eras, from Bach and Beethoven to Blind Willie Johnson and Chuck Berry, Senegalese percussion to Solomon Island panpipes. Dozens of natural sounds of our planet -- birds, a train, a baby's cry -- are collaged into a lovely audio poem called Sounds of Earth. There are spoken greetings in 55 human languages, and one whale language, and more than one hundred images encoded in analog that depict who, and what, we are.  (To hear those greetings and Sounds of Earth and see a handful of the images, visit NASA/JPL-Caltech's Voyager site!)
Etched on the record’s gold-plated aluminum jacket is a diagram explaining where it came from, and how to play it. 
Astronomer and science educator Carl Sagan chaired the visionary committee that created the original Voyager Golden Record forty years ago. Astronomer and SETI pioneer Frank Drake was the technical director, writer Ann Druyan was creative director, science writer Timothy Ferris produced the record, artist Jon Lomberg designed it, and artist Linda Salzman Sagan organized the greetings. 
Voyager I entered interstellar space in 2013. It’s almost 13 billion miles away from Earth, and in about 40,000 years it will be within 1.6 light years of a star in the constellation of Camelopardalis. Voyager II is right on its tail. We may never know whether an extraterrestrial civilization ever listens to the Golden Record. 
But now for the first time in history, to celebrate Voyager's 40th anniversary next year, you'll be able to experience it for yourself the way it was meant to be played.
An exquisitely-designed objet d'art, this limited edition Voyager Golden Record: 40th Anniversary Edition vinyl box set will only be available through this Kickstarter. It is the ultimate album package of the ultimate album package.
The cloth-covered box with gold foil inlay will house three, heavyweight translucent gold vinyl LPs protected by poly-lined paper sleeves. The LPs will contain all of the same magnificent music, greetings, and sounds as contained on the original Voyager Golden Record, nearly two hours of audio. (Track list below.) Those records will slip into old style tip on, black ink and gold foil jackets. The audio will be complemented by a beautifully-designed hardbound book of captivating images from the original interstellar message, glorious photos of the planets returned to Earth from the Voyager probes, compelling essays, and ephemera from the project's history. 
Each set will include a color, plastic digital download card with a code to access all of the audio in MP3 or FLAC format. A lithograph of the iconic Golden Record cover diagram, printed with gold metallic ink on archival paper, high-quality enamel pin of that same diagram, and a custom turntable slipmat featuring NASA/JPL-Caltech's heliocentric view of the Voyager spacecrafts' trajectories across the solar system will complete the box set.
We are honored that Timothy Ferris, the original producer of the Golden Record, will be in the recording studio with us to remaster the audio for vinyl, drawing from the highest-quality sources we can access.
The overwhelming majority of the funds raised from this historic reissue will go directly to the high production costs, licensing, and royalties incurred in creating this lavish box set. All manufacturing, except perhaps the vinyl pressing, will take place in North America at highly-respected facilities using the finest materials.
We are excited about some very special plans we have for the net proceeds from this project. Please click here!
The creation and launch of the Voyager Golden Record was a testament to the power of science and art to ignite humanity’s sense of curiosity, delight, and wonder. That is the mindset with which as we approach this effort to publicly release the Voyager Golden Record as actual phonograph records for the very first time. It is as relevant now as it was in 1977. Perhaps even more so.
Our hope is that The Golden Record: 40th Anniversary Edition will provoke questions about our place in the universe, open our minds to possibility, and serve as a reminder that the future is really up to all of us.
Your support means the world(s) to us. 
Thank you,
David, Tim, and Lawrence
David Pescovitz is editor/managing partner of Boing Boing, the technology and culture web site with more than 5 million readers, and a research director at the nonprofit Institute for the Future. A career science and technology journalist, he has written for the New York Times, Scientific American, Popular Science, and many other publications. 
Timothy Daly is a manager at the iconic Amoeba Music in San Francisco. A veteran of the music industry for 18 years, he also owned and operated the label Yik Yak (2003-2010), specializing in limited edition LP releases of experimental and avant-garde music.
Lawrence Azerrad has created graphic design and comprehensive visual identity systems for clients such as The Clinton Foundation, The Beach Boys, Miles Davis, Sting and seven album packages for alternative rock band Wilco. Azerrad’s work is included in the book The Greatest Album Covers of All Time and he is the author of a design history of the supersonic luxury airliner Concorde.

updates.update_userinfo: Happy solstice and a Grammy nomination for the Voyager Golden Record!
updates.update_content:
Dear backers,
As the nights grow longer and 2017 draws to a close, we wanted to thank you all once again for celebrating Voyager's 40th anniversary year with us. It's been an exhilarating trip filled with wonder, chaos, and beauty. We’re grateful to you all for helping make it possible. 
We’re thrilled to share with you that the Voyager Golden Record: 40th Anniversary Edition was nominated for a 2018 Grammy for “Best Boxed Or Special Limited Edition Package.” We at Ozma Records and LADdesign are honored to be included on such a stellar list of magnificent artifacts at the intersection of music and design. Thank you for taking us there. (And if you happen to be a voting member of the Recording Academy, we would appreciate your consideration. The deadline to vote is tomorrow, December 21.)

Dearest backers,
The first batch of US orders has shipped via USPS! Unfortunately we were unable to automatically email all our backers whose box set went out. However, over the next few days we will email those of you whose orders shipped via USPS and, if necessary, provide you with a tracking number.
We will be sending the rest of the US box set orders via FedEx SmartPost. That service utilizes the USPS for final delivery. FedEx will automatically email you a tracking number so that you can track your package from that point on. Please note that the sender may show as either Ozma Records or Furnace MFG.

updates.update_userinfo: Watch the skies, and your mailboxes
updates.update_content:
Dear backers,

We hope you had a wonderful Voyager 2 launch anniversary on Sunday and, for those of you who could see it, a magnificent solar eclipse experience on Monday!  Voyager 1's launch anniversary is September 5. 
We are thrilled to announce that this Friday, the Voyager Golden Record: 40th Anniversary Edition vinyl box sets will start shipping! As mentioned, it will take approximately 3 to 4 weeks from now to carefully pack and ship all the boxes. There are myriad moving parts so we appreciate your patience as you await arrival!

Dear backers,
Over the last year, "NBC Nightly News" producer Mary Beth Toole has followed our project, sending a video crew to document mastering engineer Bernie Grundman cutting the records, and interview us at Stoughton Printing Company during the recent press check. We're excited that the NBC Nightly News short feature about the Voyager Golden Record will air tomorrow evening, Sunday 8/13/17. We've also been told that a slightly extended version of the story will run next Sunday 8/20 on “Weekend Today.”

updates.update_userinfo: The process, the product, and a new edition
updates.update_content:
Dear backers,
As promised, we are delighted to share some snapshots and video clips (below this message) from our recent visit to Stoughton Printing Company in City of Industry, California. For 50 years, the fine artisans at Stoughton, still owned by the original family, have produced the finest album packages in the world for releases by The Doors, Rolling Stones, Grateful Dead, Led Zeppelin, and Neil Young and labels like Blue Note and Third Man. (For more on the fascinating history of Stoughton, see this article in Collectors Weekly by our friend Ben Marks.)

updates.update_content:
Dearest backers,
We are right on schedule to ship the vinyl box sets to you later this month! If you haven't filled out your backer address survey yet, please do that to ensure that your package is sent to the correct location! According to the Kickstarter support pages: 
"You can review your survey responses by logging into the account from which you originally pledged, visiting the project page and clicking the `View Pledge` button located to the right of the project image. One quick way to view project pages is to check Backed Projects on your account."

Dear Backers,
The 40th anniversary of Voyager is just three months away, and we’re on track to ship your Voyager Golden Record: 40th Anniversary Edition for August delivery. The vinyl is in the queue for pressing by Furnace/Pallas; the book and packaging are being prepped for production by the good people at Stoughton Printing Co. in Los Angeles.
As the shipping date gets closer, we'll send out a mailing address survey to those of you who pledged for the vinyl box set. We're waiting until the last possible moment to request your address so we can ensure that we have your most current information.

Dearest backers,
As we hit publish on this update, Voyager 1 is 20,608,911,338 kilometers from Earth while Voyager 2 is 17,066,487,148 kilometers away. (Track them here.) Thanks to you, our amazing journey also continues!
In the next few weeks, we will send out our backer survey to request your mailing address. We will ship the vinyl box sets in early August at the latest with the other rewards going out by the end of April. If your shipping address changes after you fill out the backer survey, just send us a message with your new information.

Dear backers,
In the foothills of the San Gabriel Mountains above Pasadena, California lies a massive building marked with a sign that sparks the imagination of all who see it: Spacecraft Assembly Facility. This is Building 179 at NASA's Jet Propulsion Laboratory where for 50 years, scientists and engineers have assembled the spacecraft, robots, and instruments that have made their way into space and taught us so much about what lies beyond Earth. Last week, we were fortunate enough to make a brief visit to the awe-inspiring cleanroom of the Spacecraft Assembly Facility where engineers were constructing the Mars 2020 rover. High on the walls above the workspace are huge emblems representing each of the missions that were assembled there, including Galileo, Cassini, Mariner, Viking, Spirit, and, the reason for our visit, Voyager 1 and 2. Indeed, before stopping at the Spacecraft Assembly Facility, we paid our respects to JPL's magnificent full scale model of the Voyager and one of the few original Golden Records still on Earth.

Dearest backers,
Happy new year! 
We started off 2017 in a legendary Hollywood recording studio remastering the Voyager Golden Record audio. At the console was Bernie Grundman, the Grammy-winning audio engineer who mastered classic albums like Prince's "Purple Rain," Michael Jackson's "Thriller," and Dr. Dre's "The Chronic." We were again honored to be joined by Timothy Ferris, producer of the original Voyager Record, who continues to bring his experienced ear and deep historical knowledge to the process. Timothy's son Patrick Ferris, an archival music researcher and accomplished musician in , was also kind enough to share his sharp musical intuition and keen observations with us.

campaign.story:
CASTING UPDATE!
Amazing news!!! We've got our band cast! Steve Agee, Jordan Carlos, Seth Herzog and Dave Hill will be starring as our Boy Banders!
(now onto the original pitch...)
After decades of writing comedy for other people, we’re making our first movie, right here in our hometown of Dayton, Ohio. It’s not about cancer or global warming, it’s not about orphans in the Sudan or anything else that makes an indie film. It’s a silly goofball comedy imagining a boy band who’ve grown up into balding, fat idiots. And we need your help to make it, to make it right, and to make it here in Ohio.
I mean, we also happen to believe that laughter makes the world a better place. Comedy is all we know and love, and this feature is the culmination of our life's work. It's literally our only path to emotional, spiritual and comedical fulfillment.
PROBLEM:
Los Angeles is the mecca of moviemaking, but the cost of living is so high that it prevents real creative experimentation because everyone is just trying to get whatever work they can to pay the bills.
SOLUTION:
Pack up my family, move back to my hometown where you can rent a 3 bedroom house for the price you can rent a parking space in a big city, and spend every extra cent and every extra minute on projects that MEAN something to us. In this case - a comedy about 40 year old boy banders who are still singing about making out, the mall, and making out at the mall.
ABOUT THE PROJECT: 
A brand new musical comedy film about the boy band “❤️Throb” and lead singer Johnny Throbstein, who have spent every day of the past 17 years working on the follow up to their multi-platinum debut album, leaving them older, fatter, balder, and less “boyish” than any boy band has a right to be. They’ve run out of money and today is their last day in the studio to finish the album they hope will return them to their former international glory. 
Written by Stephen Levinson (The Tonight Show) and Joel Moss Levinson (that one speedo video from the internet.) Staring Seth Herzog (The Tonight Show), Jordan Carlos (The Nightly Show with Larry Wilmore) and Steve Agee (The Sarah Silverman Program) and more hilarious people we haven't cast yet. 
With a crew made up of amazing people from across the Miami Valley, and filmed right here in Dayton, we intend to do for Dayton what John Waters did for Baltimore! What The Farrelly Brothers did for Providence, RI! What Mussolini did for... wait, wait, strike that last part. 
WHERE THE FUNDS GO:
The vast majority of the money goes to local Ohioan’s who make their money in film. Lighting, grips, sound people, assistant directors, line producers - like the three people we showed you in that video - sound guy Ben Devine, Producer Kathleen Hartshorn and Coordinator Will Brown:
- all of whom work hard to carve out a living making videos in Ohio and, like us, spend most of their time on commercials for products they aren’t passionate about. Everyone is willing to work for less than they’re worth to make an incredible comedy right here in Ohio, but we can’t ask people to work for NOTHING. Plus catering (you know, so no one starves), equipment rentals, editors, and more. If we hit our reach goals, it allows us to film in unique Dayton only locations - The Art Institute, The Masonic Temple, The Cannery, etc.
Ben, Kathleen and Will are just three of the amazing locals helping to make this movie happen!
IMPACT AND HOW IT HELPS
Have you ever SEEN a good comedy movie? Do you need to be told how it helps? Okay, here’s some things it does and some things it doesn’t do, try to guess which is which: 
Makes you feel good 
Creates a drought resistant tomato
Prevents Nuclear war 
Makes people laugh 
Gives you something awesome to quote and/or talk about with your friends. 
Puts an end to racism 
Provides a much needed escape from parenting your children for 2 hours 
Is relaxing 
Is fun 
Improves the local economy*
(correct answers - 1, 4, 5, 7, 8, 9, and 10* only if you support local filmmakers like us.)
TRUTH:
The universe is vast, and probably meaningless. Our existence as humans is doomed to an abject failure at best. In a few billion years, nothing we've done will have mattered. So we've decided to dedicate our lives to one thing - making the time we are here great. That's done through art. Through creation. And for us, through comedy. This is our way of giving something of value to the universe while we are still here. With your help, we can make people laugh. Maybe even make you laugh. And make ourselves laugh. And every time someone, somewhere laughs, it makes a angel cry. 
Don't you want to make angels cry?
OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP:
We don't just need your cash and your fandom, we want you to help us make this movie! That starts with this campaign and spreading the word! Beyond that, we will need extras during the shoot! We will need PROPS DONATED. Just by backing (even at the $1 level) we'll get your email address and know you're wiling to help, and can be in touch to help at every level from pre-production through marketing and carpentry!
THANK YOU:
Whether you're backing or not, we appreciate you giving enough of a damn about independent comedy to read this far. Thank you. And please help us spread the word. 
PLAY

 Update (9/8/2016):
We are ridiculously excited about raising well over half the money we’re hoping for - and to say thanks (and ask for your help in a push to get us all the way there!) we’ve created this time-lapse animation of the ultimate Voltron Boy Bander. What does it have to do with our movie? Not much! But we like creating things which is why you backed us in the first place! 
So enjoy! Tell someone (or three someone’s) and help us make some Dayton magic!
Check out the media coverage:
We got some love from Film Dayton at the start of the campaign.
Now, we have articles on Dayton.com and in the Dayton City Paper
We were on the news... FOX 45 Dayton and ABC 22 Dayton
WDTN.com gave us a TV spot on Living Dayton
Dayton Local wrote a piece
GemCity Podcast had us on their podcast show

campaign.story:
Miss out on backing Fidget Cube?
  What is Fidget Cube?
Fidget Cube is a desk toy for anyone who likes to fidget.
        30 seconds of your time could make the difference in growing the Fidget Cube community. Hit one of the buttons below and tag a friend or coworker who can't stop fidgeting!
        How do I use it?
It's simple. Fidget Cube (patent pending) has six sides. Each side features something to fidget with:
              Fidgeting that matches your style.
Fidget Cube is available in 10 different color schemes:
Dice, Graphite, Midnight, Aqua, Sunset, Berry, Fresh, Retro, Kickstarter Edition, and Backer Designed (design voted on by the Fidget Family!).
            Why fidget?
We love this question. It's not uncommon to hear fidgeting being spoken about negatively. It's often labeled as unprofessional and deemed as anti-intellectual behavior.
But in reality, the exact opposite has been suggested to be the case. Below are just some of many resources highlighting the work that's being done to learn more about this behavior:
The Science Of Why We Fidget While We Work
Squirm With Purpose
Stress Toys: Mindlessness With A Purpose?
The Benefits Of Fidgeting For Students With ADHD
Why Do We Fidget?
Using Stress Balls To Focus The Attention Of Students
We believe that the way we look at fidgeting needs to change.
This behavior isn't one that should continue to be stigmatized and mocked as unbecoming or inappropriate. We are passionate about the idea that fidgeting is a process that, with the right tools and outlet, can have positive and real-life applications.
  Where can I use Fidget Cube?
  It was incredibly important to us that the design of Fidget Cube was one that would look great on any desk, whether that desk belonged to a student or a CEO.
There are really no limits to when and where you can use Fidget Cube. Use it while listening to a lecture, or while studying for that upcoming test. Use it in the next meeting you have to attend (or lead). Use it at your desk while working on projects. Enduring a lengthy commute and need to relieve some stress? Fidget away. Marathoning a Netflix series? Yep, you can fidget then too.
  But I already have a pen. Do I really need Fidget Cube?
Pens (and the wonderful clicking they do) were a huge inspiration in the design process of Fidget Cube. They are probably one of the most commonly used fidget "tools". We like to see Fidget Cube as more of a fidget "toolbox". You don't have to be constrained to simple clicking, you can pick your poison based on your mood. Yes... We are very serious about our fidgeting.
  I don't really fidget. Would I enjoy Fidget Cube?
We think so! Not everyone fidgets the same amount. But spending the last few years deeply interested in the process of fidgeting, we've observed the fact that almost everyone fidgets to some extent, in a variety of ways.
Maybe you're not the type of person who uses objects like paper clips or pencils to fidget with. If that's the case, it's very likely you fidget in some other way, such as bouncing your knee up and down, tapping your foot, or picking at lint in your pocket.
We believe that Fidget Cube provides a tangible way to capture your floating attention, regardless of whether you fidget consciously or subconsciously.
  Rewards.
For believing in our vision, we want to thank you! Check out our rewards below:
    Stretch Goals.
         The Team.
  We're Antsy Labs, and more specifically, Matthew and Mark McLachlan - brothers that have a passion for designing solutions to problems we come across in daily life.
Where are you in the process?
After handfuls of prototypes, we've tweaked every last detail to arrive at the Fidget Cube you see today. We've got a number of working units, but in order to make enough for you to have one as well, we need to place a substantial minimum order for the first production run of Fidget Cube. That's why we're offering Fidget Cube to this awesome community before anyone else.
What does your timeline look like?
Fidget Cube has been an idea we've been dying to bring to fruition since it was first conceived in 2012. The product you're seeing in this project is the result of innumerable hours of iterating and reiterating. We're perfectionists, and we wanted to make sure we got this one right.
Below, you'll see a brief outline of the journey we're on with Fidget Cube, starting from the first discussion about it to when all of you joined the story (and where we go from here)!
We are insanely excited to get Fidget Cube into your hands. So you can be sure that we're going to continue to work day and night until the very last Fidget Cube has shipped.
  Help Out By Sharing Fidget Cube With Your Friends! (#fidgetfever)
Like what you're seeing? Great! Don't be shy about sharing Fidget Cube with your friends. We've made it super easy. Just hit one of the buttons below (or at the top of the page).
The more people who know about Fidget Cube, the larger our community will become! And the larger the community, the better we'll be able to make Fidget Cube!
We can't do this without you!
        Questions?
Ask away! Shoot us a message or post a comment and we'll do our best to get back to you with an answer.
Feedback?
Got a creative idea you think we should implement with Fidget Cube? Don't hesitate - let us know! Fidget Cube is being made possible by you, and we want you to be a part of the creative process as well.
International Backers
This project isn't just for backers in the United States. We'll be shipping Fidget Cube worldwide!
That being said, there are unique processes that apply specifically to international backers that we'd like you to be aware of. Please note that there is no way for us to charge any additional amount on our end for any applicable VAT/duties that may be a result of a specific country's local tax code. Therefore, these fees may be incurred upon receipt of your reward. These fees are the responsibility of each backer, and additional information regarding VAT/duties can be found in our FAQ below.
In addition, due to first class shipping fees and the dimensions of Fidget Cube, shipping rates may seem a bit high for some international locations. We calculated shipping rates beforehand, and are able to swallow some of the shipping costs on orders of 1 or 2 Fidget Cubes. Please note that shipping becomes completely free when you pledge for 5 or more Fidget Cubes.
Some Final Thoughts.
While we strongly believe in the many benefits of fidgeting, we aren't claiming to cure any illness or condition. Fidget Cube is a fun, unique way to customize your fidgeting. When designing Fidget Cube we were inspired by research that claims fidgeting might actually help individuals focus their attention. We have personally found that it helps us stay focused in boring meetings and while working on projects.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This isn't our first rodeo. We've brought several Kickstarter projects to life in the past, and have learned from our experiences. While we have been relentlessly concerned with the details throughout designing, prototyping, and planning for production, there is always the chance that pesky Murphy guy may make an entrance with that law of his.

In the event that things don't go as planned, whether it's a delay in the manufacturing timeline, shipping date, or something else, we promise to communicate honestly with you and work around the clock until we correct the issue.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Our Kickstarter campaign has ended but you can still get yours from our website.
Smoovie is a video stabiliser that fits in your pocket, is easy to use for all abilities and the most affordable option for recording smooth video on the go!
Our revolutionary design means Smoovie is significantly lighter and more compact than other video stabilisers. We’re excited because professional looking video is now simple, compact and affordable enough for everyone!
Take it anywhere and everywhere, and when inspiration strikes you'll have it to record great video to keep and share forever. Use Smoovie at home, on the go or on your next adventure!
Here's how using Smoovie compares to handheld.
Traditional video stabilisers are much bigger and heavier, with tricky and time consuming set up. Instead of relying on weight and friction Smoovie cleverly uses magnetic force, allowing anyone to record smooth video without all that bulk.
PLAY

Be more creative with you video! Here's what we shot in a day in London. (No post stabilisation)  
We've made Smoovie really simple easy to set up. Just pull out the telescopic counterweight balance to the marker for your smartphone or GoPro, and Smoovie calibrates itself! Aaand action!
Be more creative with your shots! The handle is adjustable so you can get the shots you want. Get up high or go down low!
Plus with a more natural handgrip there's no more holding your smartphone at odd angles so no more wrist ache!
The patent-pending gimbal design uses two lightweight but super strong neodymium magnets. This magnetic attraction is what keeps shots steady by reducing the shaking created when you walk or move. Go where you like and record fantastic looking smooth videos!
Compact size 19cm x 4cm x 3.5cm (and extends up to 11cm).

Weight 125 grams (4.4 oz), that's less than a Big Mac!
Holds All popular Apple, Android and Windows smartphones up to 86mm in width and 225 grams in weight. Plus all GoPro models with Smoovie Plus.
Materials Two strong neodymium N42 magnets, durable ABS and acetal plastic body, protective TPE rubber pads and long-lasting stainless steel telescopic tubes.
It's not quite as good as the large, heavy and expensive equipment that professionals use. But we're excited about Smoovie because it's affordable, easy for everyone and can be taken everywhere. When inspiration strikes, you'll have it! 
For GoPro users you can capture all of the action with Smoovie Plus. With the Smoovie Plus option you'll get Smoovie for smartphones with an additional interchangeable adapter to use with your GoPro tripod mount.
Back us today and help us go into production. Not only will you get yours by June but to say thanks you'll get Smoovie and Smoovie Plus at the lowest special Kickstarter prices. 
Estimated RRP is £19.99 for Smoovie and £21.99 for Smoovie Plus. 
After five months of development and four rounds of rapid prototyping using 3d printing, machining and duplication techniques, our design has been tested in different scenarios and we’re really pleased with the outcome. Currently the design is going through a final iteration to refine the aesthetics so that Smoovie looks and feels great too. 
In January this year Alex travelled to China to discuss the manufacture of the Smoovie project with factories the team had long term relationships with already. After comparing the quality of prototypes produced and manufacturing processes, a selection was made.
We are confident that the manufacturer we have chosen is best suited to help us get Smoovie ready for mass production so that we can deliver a product that satisfies our requirements and more importantly that you'll be happy with.
We are an experienced team based in London and HK who have designed, developed and delivered products  on a global scale. We know how to bring innovative ideas to life and take them to market. 
Our product designer Alex Kalogroulis has worked on many innovational designs. In his early years he worked alongside British Inventor Sir Clive Sinclair on the award-winning A-Bike which is displayed in London’s Design Museum. Alex has also led design on other products like Sea Scooters and Smart Touch kitchen gadgets. He also teaches future designers on the Innovation Design Engineering master’s course at London’s Royal College of Art. 
We're so excited to see what you'll do with Smoovie. Let's keep in touch, join us on Twitter and Facebook. 
Your contribution matters so so much. We can only make this happen with your help. If we don't reach our goal we won't be able to go into production. Please help us share Smoovie with your friends so that we can make Smoovie together!
                                        If you like us and want to share about Smoovie here's our press kit. We like you too!
Need anything else or just want to chat? Please email alex@pocketsmoovie.com
This project is promoted by Jellop, a direct­ response online advertising agency specializing in Kickstarter campaigns on Facebook Ads and Google AdWords.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
With years of experience our team really understand industrial design, working with manufacturers to get it right and delivering product all over the world.

We've already spent a lot of time prototyping, testing and refining Smoovie to get it right for you. Working closely with our manufacturer to continuously learn and improve from prototype to production our aim is to work quickly with them so that you get your Smoovie on time. 

We've been conservative with our timeline and accounted for short delays that may arise. As with all products being mass produced for the first time we know that sometimes unforeseen scenarios can occur. Should this happen we promise our backers that we will do everything and work hard to deliver on spec and as quickly as possible.

Production is complete and we’re currently packing the final Smoovies before sending to our fulfilment centre this week. From there Smoovie orders will then be shipped all over the world in batches. To find out when you can expect yours here are our estimated arrival dates for Smoovie:
China 1-3 August 
Hong Kong 4-6 August
US + Canada 11-13 August
EU 12-15 August
ROW 16-18 August

We're excited to let you know our product designer Alex has arrived back from a successful trip to the factory. Here’s a little update from him on how well his visit went!
“Pilot production had been completed ready for my arrival and I personally checked all units for defects. Any issues were addressed by a very cooperative manufacturing team and the pilot production repeated and improved until units passed a strict quality control standard. This process was completed within 48 hours before we gave the green light for production to go ahead.”

Today we have shared our survey with all our amazing backers. Please share your details with us and we'll work on shipping them out to you safely and as quickly as possible. 
We can now confirm that final assembly of the Smoovie will begin in early July with completion due by 10 July. Alex and the Smoovie team will be overseeing this in China to help make sure Smoovie is made to the specifications and quality we are happy with. Once checked and packed, orders will be shipped to Hong Kong before being sent out to customers via Hong Kong Post airmail.

The Kickstarter community have really helped us get this far and we're excited to have such a successfully funded project! We just wanted to take some time to show some Kickstarter love and share about a few of our friends. We think you'll like them too!
